review: At any CPK, I always order the tomato basil spaghettini with grilled chicken. This place has got to be the worst I've tasted. The spaghettini was good, correctly cooked and seasoned however the grilled chicken-omg, the chicken was so salty. I couldn't even mask the salt when I combined it with the spaghetti in one mouthful.  As for the service, the waitress didn't come by our table once in between the time she gave us our check and the times she came to get our orders and give us our drinks.  Lastly, the cherry limeade I ordered was way too sweet. I've never had it before but I'm pretty sure something like what I had isn't supposed to be on the menu. Either everyone in Palo Alto likes their food overly salted and overly sugared or the chef/bartender here has too heavy of a hand with the seaoning. I'm thinking it's the latter.

CPK is the way to my heart. It's better than Round Tables & Pizza Hut & even Mountain Mike's, although that last one is pretty good in my book too. I'm not big on pizza (I'll eat it but I tire of it easily) but I feel as if I would enjoy any kind of pizza from CPK! I've yet to try more! I haven't tried any of its pasta seeing as pizza is its specialty, but maybe next time, cos there will be a next time!

Wonderful here-- at night, it's so beautiful looking out the window at all the christmas lights on the trees....STILL on the trees!  Ordered the 4cheese+tomato pizza, split between two people is perfect.  Easy to finish, and easy to feel satisfied.  The crust was slightly sweet, which is great, so it doesn't feel like you're OD-ing on salt... perfection in a moderately sized circle topped with melted cheese and yes that is the amazing goodness of PIZZA!~~~

3.5 stars - Quiet for late Thursday dinner.   Service attentive, food good:  chipotle pizza and tiramisu desert.  Pizza a bit too salty for my pallet.  Cozy place for 2, includes a full bar on site, and take out.

This is a California Pizza Kitchen ASAP. I'm not sure exactly what that means, but I can tell you the differences that I've observed. The biggest difference is that instead of being a sit-down restaurant where you're served by wait staff, they have you start by ordering at the counter. You're given a number that you leave on your table, and they'll find you and drop off your pizza. I guess that makes it ASAP? Dunno. Whatevs. Service has always been fine. My pizza has come out quickly, and people are friendly. As for the taste, California Pizza Kitchen is decent, but there's better pizza out there. What I do like about it, and what would be the only reason for me to go there, is their creativity with toppings and combinations that other pizza places don't typically do. I also like their honey-wheat whole-grain option for the crust. A couple of my favorite flavors are the pear and gorgonzola, and the white pizza with applewood bacon. The pear and gorgonzola is just delightful. The sweetness of the pairs is balanced with the sharpness of the gorgonzola cheese. I also do like these kinds of flavors, that just make your taste buds dance. The white pizza is a bit milder; it comes with sauteed garlic spinach along with five different types of cheese: mozzarella, fontina, parmesan, ricotta, and pecorino romano. I've never been one to protest several different types of cheeses, but as you can see, the cheeses are much milder than the gorgonzola on the other pizza! I like ordering this one with applewood bacon tossed on it; the saltiness of the bacon adds a bit more flavor to the pie. Those are a couple of my favorites, although in general, I tend to avoid California Pizza Kitchen. There are definitely better options from local pizza places.

Why do they only have one person on the take out window from 11:30am - 1:30pm. The manager helps, but put another employee there to push the line. Take out is curbside and people picking up at the take out window. Really seems stressful and not pleasant for the customer.

This is one of my favorite restaurants ever, and one that I visit frequently. BBQ chicken salad, dynamite shrimp, and the mac and cheese (childish but hey, it's tasty) are among my favorites. The cheesecake is also good, but the best dessert ever was the sticky toffee pudding, which was taken off the menu, much to everyone's surprise. But the atmosphere is great and the people are nice, which makes a huge difference.
I lied - I've gone  back several times - the food is actually better now!

I had a huge craving for pizza and the group of friends I was with wanted pizza as well so we came here. It gets a little packed. It was a 20min wait to eat inside. We decided to opt out to eat outside. They have no 5 seaters or 6 seaters. Therefore they just added a 5th chair to a 4 seater table. The service was okay. They are for sure understaffed. Our waiter always brought us what we asked (more bread, water, refills, etc.) but he just took a long time to get it to us because he was so busy attending other tables as well. He was really nice though. The food was overall pretty decent. I had the margherita pizza.

The roasted artichoke and spinach pizza with chicken on thin crust was awesome! The server was really friendly and I don't think I actually saw the bottom of my water glass once throughout the course of the meal. I'd definitely recommend coming here for lunch or dinner.

BBQ Chicken Salad - my favorite. So delicious and so huge that you can definitely share this with another person..or better yet, order 2 dishes with 3-4 people and get one of these for sure - everyone will have a good amount of salad on their plate for sure.  This location is small - but it's cute and it's not crowded.  The area that the restaurant is at is perfect  because there's sunlight that come in through the windows that makes you feel so bright and happy and cheery.  Service was great too - and fast!  I'd also recommend the spinach and artichoke dip.

shopping and patio seating...dog friendly mall and restaurant...bowl of water for the animals...bottle of nobilo sauvignon blanc for the humans...light, crisp and refreshing wain...white corn guacamole and chips to start...sweet crisp corn and avocado a good combination...cheap and only $four starter....waiter recommendation being the chicken tequila fettuccine $thirteen....great creamy saucing and perfect pasta...finding a favorite pasta dish at cpk...waldorf chicken salad $fourteen for greens balance...finding chicken loaded and fruity...balsamic vinaigrette choice for lighter taste...crisp, cheesy and walnut salad creation...meal and drinks for $seventy total for two...

I'm not a huge fan of CPK's food.  I think it generally tends to be pretty mediocre and is overpriced for what it is.  However, this location is much better in terms of service than the location in downtown Palo Alto, where we had a terrible experience (see  ) My salmon pasta was pretty bland but edible.   My fiance liked his pizza ("The Works") pretty well.  The service was decent.  We will definitely go here as opposed to the one in DTPA when my fiance gets a CPK craving.

Went on a Saturday night to CPK so the place was very packed. The menu is set outside for those who want to check what they offer and prices. Since it was a 25 minute wait, they offer to give them my   phone number  so I could go shopping while our table was ready. The server was so nice and very attentive to our needs. Totally recommend  the meat cravers pizza. Cons: The pizza very small so each person should by their own if they want to get full. I didn't since the host told me that the one pizza could be shared by two people which is not true. Only one size;10inches(6 slices). The wait is long,30 minutes to get the food served. Overall, a great place near a shopping center, outside seating for those who want to  enjoy the weather and dog friendly.
I love this place - A list of my favorites:   Sedona Soup, Tri Colore Salad, Tequila Lime Fettuccini and the Chipotle Chicken Pizza. :D

Pretty delicious place! & the air condition is most certainly a plus! I thought I had the best spinach artichoke dip ever at Elephant Bar, but I was surely wrong! This location has wonderful outdoor seating as well & our waiter was the sweetest! I will most certainly come back.

The one at Stanford Mall is new, clean and modern. Service was great and I love thin crust pizza..and the Thai style is my favorite, I can't find this one in the freezer aisle ;P  They brought out my pizza a little on the 'toasty' side and It didn't really bother me but the manager said that they were going to bring me one to make up for the 'toastyness' I think they thought it was maybe burnt for their quality control who knows but I had a whole free pizza to go. score.   The salads are also pretty tasty (try the chopped Mediterranean its yummy.)  Lots of outdoor table, some with pop up umbrellas for shade, kid friendly...just know that it takes some time for the pizzas to bake so order a small appetizer if you have kiddies.
Goods Real good personnel pizza. My fav is veggie pizza choices of gluten free crust available and even honey wheat crust. Gourmet  salads choices  Cons Portions are smaller

This was my first time at the CPK in the Stanford Shopping Center - I usually go to the one at Valleyfair. This restaurant didn't impress me but it didn't disappoint either; the waiters were extremely helpful and were prompt with seating you/getting your orders/drinks/food/etc. Food was also pretty good - in my opinion, it was probably more flavorful than the other CPK in Valleyfair. I ordered something new on the menu: Chicken Tequila Fettucine. It was delicious! The pasta sauce was very creamy, and had a very delicious lime & jalepeno taste with hints of spice. I'd say the portions aren't too big or too small, a perfect size to fill you up while leaving just enough space for dessert. I'm not crazy about this restaurant or this particular location, but it's a great place to go to every once in a while if you have a party that's split on getting pizza, salad, pasta, or sandwiches. Also super convenient if you are shopping nearby!

Completely forgettable experience. Food is overpriced and nothing special. Service was slow and sporadic.  I had high expectations for my Pesto Chicken Pizza, considering I'm at a place with pizza in its name, but it tasted like it came from Safeway's frozen food section. Actually, I probably would have been better off getting a frozen pizza. Lacked flavor AND chicken. The crust was dry and flimsy, not crispy like I was hoping for.  Friend #1 ordered Korean BBQ tacos and he couldn't finish them. Enough said.  Friend #2 ordered a Cobb salad and she liked it...but it's salad, so it doesn't really say much, but it saved me from giving CPK the 1 star of doom.

The CPK at Standford Shopping Mall is just your ordinary CPK.  It's good but not somewhere where you would dine routinely.  The salads at CPK are always good as are the pizzas.  But their salads can be ridiculously loaded with calories so choose wisely (or not!). :-)  The staff here was attentive and the restaurant was mostly comfortable.   Unfortunately we were seated close to the door that opens up to the patio which meant getting constant blasts of cold air.  It was December and my San Diego body is too soft for any blasts of cold air.  But I must say, I was not the only one who was chilly because the people at the tables around me were also wearing their coats, which isn't the most comfortable for eating.  Who wants to lick the barbecue pizza sauce off of my wool coat sleeve?
Always crowded, especially at lunch time.  They have one of the best asian chicken salads around.  Other than that it is a chain, but a very consistently good chain.

Great location! The Stanford Mall is an outdoor mall with good restaurants and shops. We got to California Pizza Kitchen around 530pm on a Friday and luckily we got there the time that we did. Right at 6pm , people started to come in! Our waitress was a tad bit busy so we didn't get great service but it was good enough. I believe there was only 1 waitress for our section. We ordered the Original BBQ Pizza and my friend ordered a flat crust pizza (I forgot what it was called). The pizza was so good! Crust wasn't too thick and too thin to where you had to fold the pizza in half just to eat it. The bbq flavor wasn't overpowering to where it didn't taste like pizza anymore. It was so good I ate the whole thing! I can't wait to come back to try different dishes!

My wife and I eat here all the time, and they do an excellent job with their food and their level of customer service. I think we could live off of nothing but Tostada Pizza and BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad if it came to that!  We also use their curbside to-go service weekly and their to-go staff is absolutely exceptional. In fact, we go there so frequently and use their curbside service so often and have never had any problems. So, I just had to make sure I wrote them an excellent review, because the staff at this particular location really deserve the recognition!

Doing take out? Make sure you press option 3 instead of 1 (take out option). My order was lost and no where to be found when I got there to pick up lunch for me and my teammates. How can an order be gone? I was told option 1 goes to a call center in Denver and then it never got to them... great... Luckily, the person in charge was nice and gave us a dessert for free. But the dessert tasted terrible. I love tiramisu and this tiramisu sucked butt. It was so bad that I can't even bring myself to eat half. So, do not get their tiramisu, ever!! I asked to have quinoa on the side, and they didn't give me quinoa on the side... We almost left without our order of drinks if my teammate hadn't noticed our drinks weren't in the take out bag they gave us -_-

I'm going to give negative review on this place. Even though the food was tasty, service wasn't.  My friends and I (total 7 people) went there last week after visiting Stanford University.  I asked our server HUGO for 3 separate orders.  Hugo took our orders.  We had salads and pizzas. After receiving checks I found out that each check has 18% gratuity, which is kind of high for such a service. I asked him "why tips are including in check and so high?" He answered something like "because it is party gratuity" Then I asked "how many people are considered as a party?" He wasn't sure and said 8 and up. OK. There are 7 of us. Will it make any different?  I wasn't satisfied with his answer and decided to speak with a manager. He wasn't aware what's going on so answered that party - 8 and up. But when I explained that 18% is a bit high gratuity since we are not a party, he started wriggle and cover Hugo. I was frustrated. I thought that tips are the way of appreciation for the service rendered and totally free will. Turned out I was wrong. Will avoid this place in future.

I really like CPK!  The Hawaiian pizza is my ALL TIME FAVORITE.  But this time I tried it with BBQ chicken, and it was not that great... The BBQ sauce is too overtaking for my tastebuds.  I never understood why they use actual BBQ sauce on it.   Pizza is also very expensive here.  At least in my standards, I honestly wouldn't pay $12-$13 for a pizza that is thinly crusted and skimp.  It looks nice but I don't know if it's worth it. Spinach and artichoke dip was my table's starter, and it was so tasty!  They give you two options: corn tortilla chips and a different kind of corn tortilla (purple colored) chips.  Both were good and to top it all off, the spinach and artichoke dip was piping hot! :)  It was really gooooood. Ordered the CA Cobb salad with beets and that wasn't bad either.  Liked all the ingredients in the salad but the lettuce didn't seem to be the freshest.

Jessica and her eyelashes will astound you. They're so perfect you'd swear they're fake!  On to the pizza!  My fave is: CA Club-- salad on a pizza basically with chicken, cheese, and applewood smoked bacon topped with lettuce tossed in mayo with a slice of fresh tomato & avocado on all 6 slices of pizza. I've also tried the wild mushroom and thin crust roasted garlic, both with chicken.  *Highly recommend the Thai Crunch salad with avocado!! I finished the whole full size in an hour! Honestly thought I was going to take the rest home for the fam to try but it was just oh so good. I'm loving the edamame, crispy wonton strips, fried rice noodle sticks, chicken, peanuts, cilantro & especially the peanut dressing!  My friend ordered the chicken tortilla soup for a second time and still likes it.  Downside: the menu got smaller and they no longer have the salmon with lemon cream sauce pasta with capers & asparagus. Sad face.  Upside: the food & customer service! Seated within 5-7 min on a Friday at 7:20pm and friendly attentive staff that genuinely seem like they're happy to see you. My to go order was handled in a timely manner too and was ready for me to take home after paying the bill!  I shall return for you, CA Club pizza & Thai Crunch salad! -UPDATE 3/2015- JC (Juan Carlos) is a fantastic waiter! My friend and I sat outside on the patio for dinner around 5pm on a weekday and were treated like royalty. He was almost too attentive, always refilling our hot water pot/mugs and lemon wedge bowl, brought over honey packets, offered bread and olive oil at the start of the meal, and is just a calm, levelheaded, and overall personable individual that made sure we were taken care of. The manager came around twice to ask us how we were doing as well. I hope the quality of service never changes here.
Half roasted veggie salad is awesome.   Great service by the on-duty manager to make sure things are covered and everyone welcomed.

I waited few days after coming here in order to write a non-scathing review.  No problems at all with the food, we ordered pasta, fish tacos, & the highly regarded bbq chicken pizza. I didn't have high expectations for a chain so if it were based solely on food this would be 3.5 stars. I don't know if our waiter had a bad day or something but he acted so sullen the whole time that it brought me down. I found it strange how he insincerely asked my sister why she looked sad; mind you we came here after spending the day at the Stanford Medical Center but she played it off. After receiving & glancing at the check, we notice that we were charged extra for two entrees, two drinks, and a glass of wine that we did not order! Apparently this happened to my sister at this CPK before but she didn't catch it until she left that time. We flag down our waiter to bring up the gross overcharge and he has the NERVE to roll his eyes and say "You want me to fix that?"  It seemed as if he intentionally overcharged us and became angry after we noticed cuz if an honest mistake occurred, he would have apologized or at least fixed the mistake without the attitude. We left pretty darn angry & will avoid this location from now on.

We were 3 diners ordering salad and sandwich lunches. 2 out of 3 lunches came out at within a reasonable amount of time. The 3rd lunch came out 25 minutes later. What's the big deal? Well, to the person waiting for the food and the diners going ahead and eating it was plain awkward. I did ask our waitperson to comp the third lunch. Next thing we know the VERY aggressive "General Manager," was in our faces, angrily asking "what happened?" After my explanation, he said "ok," and walked away. A while later the bill appeared with the entree taken off. All in all, an unpleasant meal.

Whenever I have a pizza craving, I always come here! My all time fave which was on then off and now back on their menu is the pear and gorgonzola pizza, its super yummy! They have two awesome soups and great variety of salads. The service is always superb!

I had high hopes for California Pizza Kitchen at the Stanford Shopping Center.  After all, I like the frozen version of their pizza.  If a company can make a frozen pizza taste this good, then the fresh pizza should be great too, right? Wrong. Not only was the pizza slightly lower-quality than one would expect for a restaurant at this price point, but I think that the $5 frozen variety (with the same name) from Safeway actually tastes better. The restaurant looked nice.  However, it was extremely crowded.  As a result, the staff seemed a bit...frazzled...by the amount of people.  We were finally seated after 40 minutes.  We quickly ordered our food and drinks.  Yet, ironically, we had to wait another hour before we received our meal.  The irony was that our food was cold when it was served.  The waitress wasn't even apologetic.   Oddly enough, we discovered that we had been overcharged for our tab when we arrived home.  It seems like the waitress accidentally added someone else's set of drinks to our bill.  Go figure. For the price of our meal (about $50 with food, drinks and tip), we should have opted for a more trusted establishment.  The next time that we are visiting the Stanford Shopping Center, we'll probably eat at THE MELT.  It is much less expensive and the food is better.

I was very disappointed with this branch.  I am a fan of CPK, and the one I normally go to is the branch at the Valley Fair mall.  I figured it would be the same.  Wrong! I went on a weekday for dinner.  It was not too busy and maybe they were under staffed?  Our food came out really late.  Just to order a pizza and entree took 50 minutes.  Even the waitress saw that we have been waiting for a while and she apologized for it.  She was the only thing good about this restaurant.  When we got our food, both the pizza and pasta were luke warm.  How is that possible after waiting for so long?  Was it just sitting there and they just forgot to serve the food to us?  I saw other tables that came after me getting their food before we did, and they too ordered a pizza.  Well, I don't know if I'd come back to this branch again with this type of food and late service.
Service is inconsistent. Nothing special at all. The food is ok, service  needs more personalized attention to the customers.

Order the Thai Crunch Salad w/o the avocado bc it's additional $2.50. And the Garlic Cream Fettucine with chicken is delicious. Take-out didn't take no more than 15 mins. Even at their busiest nights, customer service here is great! I "really" enjoy their food here... they have many good selections of salads, pastas, pizzas, & soups! This is comfort food for me, but with a healthy twist, especially when it comes to their salad choices. I always love coming to my favorite shopping center: Stanford Mall, so it was such a treat to be back & visit a bit, as I waited for my take-out, which wasn't a long wait at all. I would have dined-in & visited the mall longer, but I've had a long day at the office. Just needed comfort food & enjoy it at home in my pj's.  I will definitely be back here: Stanford Mall & CPK! Tip: my absolute favorite bakery is at this mall too! It's Cocola's!!! ;) I can't wait to see my old friend.

Less then thrilling service.  We ordered shots of Patron Tequila and received 1/8 of a normal bar shot size still at $14 a premium shot.  Place gets crowded.  PF Chang is much better option on the same shopping plaza.

The food was actually pretty good. But the service was horrible. Our waitress was doing everything but serving us. From refilling my ice tea to asking for a side of ranch and getting it at the end of my meal.

I'm usually a regular here especially when I come for lunch. I work in Bloomingdales and today by far has been the greatest service I've had. Greg was especially amazing with my service. Will be coming more often for lunch.

It's hard to find good service at these types of restaurants nowadays.  Came here for dinner and was seated instantly if you are ok with sitting outside and with the sun shining on you.  The outside is more accommodating for strollers and children and my son can people watch.  Our nice server came by, took our orders for drinks immediately, returning with our drinks in 3 minutes. Wow...efficient!  He even informed us that our pizzas would be out shortly after waiting around for food for another 20 minutes....yeah that shortly became 10 minutes.  But we understood that the poor guy was waiting on tables outside and inside the restaurant.  Once our food came, I looked at our "full-sized" cobb salad and wondered, wow...that's one small "full" sized salad..so we had to ask the waiter...He confirmed what we ordered and realized that he mistakenly told the kitchen to prepare a Half size salad...so he immediately placed the other half and only charged us for a half-size salad ($3-4 difference). The salad was full of substance, even with the red beets.  As for our pizzas, I would not recommend the pear and gorgonzola pizza because it didn't taste nor look right...The margherita and sicilian pizzas were phenomenal.  I would come back here anyday.

I have been dining at CPK for over 15 years and it just seems to get better with age. I now come here at least once a month and am never disappointed with the food and the service. I am addicted to their avocado club egg rolls, filled with chicken, bacon, cheese and avocado... they are crispy on the outside and super delicious on the inside. They give you 6 large egg rolls cut in half (so 6 pieces) which is generous for an appetizer plate. I also love their crispy thin crust pizzas, especially the roasted artichoke and spinach. I can pretty much finish the whole thing on my own. I used to always get the Tostada pizza but now that they only serve it on thin crust, it's not the same and I don't like it as much. Finally their 2 in a bowl soup is great (Sedona Tortilla Soup + Split Pea). I thought it would be weird but they go together perfectly and both are delicious. If you want bread and butter w/ your soup you have to ask for it. They used to give you bread & butter automatically but I see they have stopped doing that. Service is always friendly and quick. Anytime I have asked for anything extra they bring it right away. The Stanford location happens to be my favorite as you can sit outside in the sunshine.

This is my typical family get-together restaurant. I've dined here ever since I was born and it always tastes better every time we come. We're never disappointed with the service or food.  My family's traditional order is 1 Large Wild Mushroom Pizza, 1 Medium Field Greens Salad, and 2 traditional cheese kids menu pizzas. Recently they have all been slightly altered. The original Wild Mushroom Pizza had their mushrooms wet and soggy. (Yes it does not sound too appetizing, but it actually tastes better since the mushrooms are easier to chew) The pizza wasn't too thin, and the dough was slightly sweet. Now they have changed the recipe so that the mushrooms don't get to be boiled, instead they are thrown onto the pizza, dry. The crust is also harder and not really sweet. The Field Greens Salad Dish was a salad with a variety of greens and leaves of all colors.  My family tradition was to exchange the chicken for shrimp and add extra walnuts. The walnuts were sugar coated which made them delightful to eat, and there were also apple slices. Together the salad tasted sweet, a tad bit sour (from the apples) and salty too. The texture was soft from the salad, chewy from the shrimp, and hard from the walnuts all at the same time. Now they have modified the salad to have goat chees mixed in, and to take out the apples. It changed the texture and flavors a ton, and it's no longer one of our favorite dishes, but we still order it for old time's sake. The kids cheese pizza was and still is just plain cheese pizza but smaller, with a sweeter thicker but softer crust. The only changes that have been made is that the dough is now thinner, and the pizza is cut into smaller pieces.   Overall still one of my favorite places to be. The staffs have always been polite and joyful when they're serving. The aura is always pleasant at CPK. Keep up the good work!

My fiance had never been to a California Pizza Kitchen, despite LOVING pizza and living in California, so we came here after some wedding registry action in the Stanford Shopping Center, and we had a really delicious meal! The menu could use some more vegetarian options, but we found some things we wanted to try.  We got the wild mushroom pizza on their whole wheat crust (killer!!) and the caramelized peach salad subbing out bleu cheese for goat cheese.  Also killer.  We finished everything and the bill was completely reasonable. They also offer a deal for two people eating together: an appetizer, two entrees, and dessert for $30.  You have to be hungry, but it sounds like you'd get your money's worth! We'd like to come back... Especially if they get more vegetarian options on their menu!  Isn't vegetarianism very Californian....?

My 8 year old loves the Mac & Cheese (but it has had too much sauce on occasion) and my daughter really likes the pesto creme penne with chicken.  Most locations have bread and butter, but you need to ask for it.  My husband and I usually share a Sicilian pizza, it's one of their thin pizzas with spicy marinara sauce, sausage, spicy capicola ham, salami, and mozzarella cheese.  It's pretty flavorful if you shake on parmesan cheese and peppers.  If we come here too many times, we'll get the blt or greek pizza with avocados.  The pizza is only enough for one, so we usually order a pasta dish to go with it.  The four cheese raviolis were kind of plain.  We order the pesto creme penne without chicken. We don't think the chicken tastes fresh, it's like the chicken they put on your pizza.  The salads are chopped too much for us.  We will get a small plate like guacamole and chips if we're really hungry.  We tried most of the appetizers at one time, but we like  the appetizers at Cheesecake factory better.  The kids may get a ice cream sundae with m & m's and we like the butter cake with ice cream and whip cream.  It's a small cake that has a harder outside crust with sugar and it's buttery tasting in the middle which goes good with ice cream. Our kids really like CPK. We've gone to the cpk's in Anaheim, Honolulu, Las Vegas, San Jose, Palo Alto, and Hillsdale,   It's pricey for pizza and pasta. but it's clean and relaxing.  Servers are usually young and professional.

Worst service I've had in a while. I got water with ice when I asked for without, but that doesn't really matter.. What DOES matter is that there was a piece of food in my water... I didn't say anything and let it slide and ordered a pasta with absolutely NO cheese... I found cheese in the pasta and the server came back and told me i was wrong and "pinky promised" me that there was no cheese.. This kind of inconsiderate behavior bothers us vegans. The pasta had cheese in it. I asked for another plate and all the server did was try to convince me that I was wrong about the cheese. He was really annoying and I definitely will not be coming back here anytime soon...

Came here on a Thursday afternoon for lunch with a GF. The place was pretty packed but we didn't have to wait long for a table. This CPK is pretty small compare to other CPKs I've been to. There's outdoor seating also. Which is a bonus for Palo Alto's sunny weather. Here's what we ordered: cobb salad thai crunch salad lettuce cups Everything was fresh. I highly recommend coming to CPK for salads. They have a good variety to choose from. The staff at this location was friendly and welcoming. Especially our waitress. Didn't catch her name. She was wearing a pink top and pregnant. She was super sweet.

Before I get started - let me just say that I'm a HUGE fan of CPK. Love their menu, from their pizza's to the salads. So, I placed a phone order 3 hours ahead prior to picking it up, and I specifically told the girl to sub out the avocado's for the grilled chicken. After placing my order, she reassured me that it'll be ready for pick-up around the time I requested. Three hours later (on my lunch break) I dropped in to pick up my phone order, and I was grateful that they had my order ready for me, BUT I glanced down at the half Thai crunch salad that I had ordered and I see avocado slices everywhere. I was so upset, because they had plenty of time to prepare one half salad w/ no complicated requests but to simply sub out the avocado's for grilled chicken. There were three girls standing near the register, giggling and discussing their weekend plans & completely ignoring me while I was trying to get someone to help me. I informed the girl that brought me my order that I didn't want the avocado's. She grabbed the salad & dashed off without saying a word. By this time, I was already ticked off. First off, I placed my order 3 hours in and I ordered one item. You would think they would get it right. I only had 30 mins and I wasn't happy about wasting my lunch standing there waiting for my food, AND to top it all off, she comes back w/ my newly made salad & shoved it in the bag and walked off without saying one word. Not one employee apologized for the delay or the mistake. I used to love coming here for lunch, but I'm no longer coming to this specific location because of their poor service and the employees simply aren't courteous. Bad service and very rude employees!

Four stars for the food, two stars for the staff. I enjoy the different flavors of CPK's dishes, and I like that they offer nice new twists to the usual fare.  I especially like the white corn guacamole with chips, the salmon on cedar plank with the corn succotash, Thai crunch salad, pepperoni and mushroom pizza, among other things. However, I've eaten at many different CPKs in different locations/states/countries, and this one has the worst wait staff of all!  I don't know if they're just less well trained, but the hosts have either been snotty, rude, or looked and sounded harassed.  And the wait staff oftentimes gets our orders confused.  I know their job is not easy, but c'mon, if they can't remember the orders in their heads, then they should write them down.  One time though, one of them wrote down the orders, and still got several of it wrong. I will still continue to eat at CPK restaurants because of the food, but most probably will no longer go back to this particular location.

VERY upset. Last two times I've ordered the chipotle chicken pizza and they ran out of the salsa that is normally served with it. So basically gave me half my order. You couldn't tell me before I ordered my pizza?

I love coming to this location, not really because of the food, but because the waiters are always so friendly and seem to love their job.  They also love our giant dog and give him so much attention while we eat (a good distraction from our food!).  The outside seating is nice, and has heat lamps to keep us nice and warm during the colder months. The pizzas are good; nothing special, but there are a lot of unique, creative options. To be honest, sometimes their pizzas taste like the frozen varieties I buy at Safeway.  But I do love coming here every so often, and it has always been a pleasant experience.  The food always comes right away, and the prices are very reasonable.

Its pizza. Good pizza. Good, reasonably priced pizza.  What makes this place amazing is that they have outdoor seating all the time with heaters!  This might not seem like a big deal to many people, but when you are toting a 90lb husky around your options of where to eat start getting pretty limited. The service deserves a special note as it is always fantastic.  Also your should definitely try their flavored lemonades, especially the mango-lemonade.  Yes, you read that right, mango-lemonade.

I was very anti CPK for a long time. I think I just had a bad experience when younger and never went back but I was missing out. I recently went with my father and had a really great pizza. It was a different kind of pizza than I ever had before and the wait staff was very nice and have great service! I can't wait to go back and try the pizza again!

NOTE: I am giving this place 4.5/5 stars, not 4. On a nice day, make sure you sit outside in the warm sun. The outside area is perfect for a lunch stop while shopping and they are outside pet-friendly! My mom and I love to come to CPK for their salads and pizzas.  Try the spinach and artichoke pizza and add avocado! So. Good. While the outside area is nice, be prepared for very slow service. Most likely the slowest service out of all the CPK's i've been to (and I have been to a few). GOOD: -Food is delicious as always -Outside area is beautiful on a nice day and they have heat lamps on cold days -Great for lunch in between shopping -Outside pet-friendly! Our waiter gave our pup some water to drink. BAD: -Very slow service, don't sit outside if you're in a hurry.

I like California pizza kitchen in general, but not at this location.  We had Margarita pizza, avocado club egg roll and a kid's Hawaiian pizza.  The kid's pizza is decent size unlike some other places.  margarita pizza is thin crust.  It is thin but not crispy at all.  The crust is soft and soggy.   Sundae is quick disappointed.  We ordered two sundaes.  Ice cream part is melted when served on both cups.  I am not sure how long the sundaes are in room temperature.  I would not recommend this store, but will go to other locations in the future.

A cheaper sit down place to eat in this mall. There isn't anything special about this place. Your typical California Pizza Kitchen. We should have walked around before we decided on what to eat because there are a lot of interesting affordable places to eat besides California Pizza Kitchen.  We arrived shortly after they opened and was given a 2 person booth indoors. We ordered: Caramelized Peach Salad with Bacon (Field greens, spinach, warm caramelized peaches, cranberries, red onions, toasted pecans and Gorgonzola tossed in housemade white balsamic vinaigrette.) - This wasn't bad but not amazing. There wasn't that many pieces of peaches, bacon, or cheese. =/  The Works Pizza - I like that it is thin. It was a pretty good pizza.  Overall, we had a good experience but if you are out there go to this little cafe's or the grocery store for lunch. Cheaper and more unique experience. As a sit down place this is probably a good place to eat.  Clean bathrooms.
Good for kids - they give a coloring sheet with crayons, pasta comes in a bowl (vs plate) that's easy for kids to eat from.
We have eaten here twice and the food has always been good. Our waiter was pleasant and attentive. Definitely a place I would come back to.

I'm obsessed with CPK. Not entirely sure why but I am.   I come to this CPK quite often, mostly for take out.;  I love their apps and being able to call in and have them know what I want based on previous orders! AWESOME! Last night I went in and was sort of complicated, I wanted to use a coupon and my rewards card.  The girl who helped me was awesome and it was her first day so big props to her!  The food is always consistent, I love the food but only let myself eat a few things because of calories.  I love CPK and will happily come back!

My rating for their food is a 5. The Five Cheese and Tomato was delish. The Salted Caramel Pudding was good but lacked the salt factor. As for their 2 star service, see below... The first impression when I walked in was just meh...  Although we were seated right away it looked like the hostesses were more interested in their own conversation than assisting us.  Our server took our order and brought our drinks out right away. When our pizza arrived I put a slice on my plate. This was a messy process due to the cheese (which I'm not complaining about). My complaint is the fact that we were never given napkins or utensils. When I did ask for napkins it seemed more like an inconvenience than anything.

Decent Pizza options with a thin crust. But i never thought coke could be served warm -_- . Or maybe it was just the glass....appetizers aren't very appealing so just skip them.  Some of the workers look like they're clinically depressed at work though so u guess the pay sucks or they just get hit on by strange men so often they can't deal with it no more.

I just come here to eat, pay, and go. There's no point in flirting with any of the waitresses since none of them are visually appealing or have a friendly attitude. They all look like zombies. Is it because they are also Stanford students? o.O EDIBLES: Wild Mushroom Pizza with an addition of bacon.  2 cups of Coke (yeah, I downed it quick) Pizza was tasty and it was raining outside, so it was nice to have a hot quick meal before heading back out again.  SERVICE: HA...What service? Our waitress looked like she was depressed or something. It seemed like a college looking guy wasn't going to give her a good tip, so she focused on the rich looking older guy at the counter. I think the flirting with him and letting him cop a feel on her was going to get her a bigger tip? Eh..do what you have to do to make ends meet? Whatever.

Walked in and the host said if we wanted to seat right away we could seat ourselves at the counter. Awesome! I was in a rush to work. The waiter working the counters was really friendly and was training someone as he was helping us.  The counter was a little dirty though. I had my purse on my lap which touched the table and when I sat back I noticed a bunch of grease and food particles on it. So being the OCD near freak that I am, I had to take a couple of napkins from the bar and wipe off the table myself lol. I didn't really mind too much though. It wasn't unbearably dirty. Bf and I shared the CA club pizza. Straight up looks like a salad on top of my pizza lol. Huge avacado slices on each piece, and like a handful of romaine lettuce. The bacon underneath was nice and crispy.  BUUUUT ew. I went to the restroom to wash my hands before I ate and I saw this lady walk out of the stall and didn't wash her hands. Alright.. If you were just another customer whatever do what you want with your nasty self lol. But as I was walking back to the counters, I saw her walk towards the back where all the employees are. Errrhmahgawd. Prayed to god she wasn't gna be the one handling my food.  So yeah.. Had to minus a couple of stars for that lol. But otherwise, we had a quick and tasty meal.

Plenty of parking all around the mall which is always a big plus.   There can be really long waits on weekends because people usually bring their whole family.  This is a pretty good location though.  There are plenty of seats outdoors letting you enjoy the nice surroundings you are in.  Service hasn't been lacking yet the many times we've been.   Prices of this place have gone up significantly it seems but the food still seems fresh and tastes not very junk foody yet don't be expecting gourmet.   I miss their Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza!

I love this particular CPK primarily for the ample parking lot and wonderful, convenient location at the Stanford Shopping Mall and the campus itself. Every time I come, the staff have been very reliable in seating us almost immediately or within a reasonable amount of time (10min max) if it is high traffic hour. The waiters are always so jovial and friendly as well, providing excellent service and always coming by to check up on you. There is complimentary bread and olive oil/butter upon request. I personally enjoy the California pizza and Sicilian pizza, the former which makes me feel like I am opting for a healthier option (has leafy greens and avocado on top). ;) Last time, I tried the spinach and mushroom flatbread to be more adventurous, but the flatbread was way too oily for my liking. All in all, solid place to grab a bite to eat after classes or work.

Came in around 5:20pm on a Friday afternoon. Our waitress was awesome, the food and drinks were quick, the only downfall was the lack of draft beer :((((. Other than that they have a full bar! I ordered a mediocre margarita and my favorite dish, the California club pizza, so good!  Minus a star for the lack of draft beer that was promised on the HQ website, everything else was delectable!

This place is so good! Even when it crowded they make time for everyone !! The kung pao spaghetti is the best. Just a little spicy so make sure you like that extra flavor. The food is always fresh and the wait time is very reasonable. I work in the mall and I always have time to sit down and eat comfortably without being rushed. The beer selection is pretty good too. I also like that they always have on file what you ordered last time; this makes it super easy I'd you forgot but really liked what you've had before.

Arrived for an early lunch and to beat the crowd. So glad I did because the restaurant and the patio area were packed by the time I left. The service was ok. Our server wasn't particularly friendly. She looked like she didn't want to be there and barely cracked a smile. Thankfully the good food made up for her lack on enthusiasm and the kitchen must've been working hard because we didn't have to wait long for our order. The layout of the restaurant is somewhat poorly designed. It can be a bit of a challenge simply walking to the restrooms because the tables and chairs are in the way.

I love CPK's tostada pizza with avocado! It tastes a lot better in the restaurant than when brought home, so eat it there. My favorite part about this pizza are the crispy chips on the top and the yummy salsa on the side. Last time, my mom and I also ordered the bianca flatbread, which was super yummy. And I see other reviews about getting bread while they wait for their food, but we definitely didn't get that! Would I come back? Yes.. nomz!

30 minutes on the waiting list with 3 people on the desk. But 4 empty tables without reservation... They were lucky my wife insisted to eat here and that the iPhone offers so many entertainment. I'd be gone asap.

Stopped by the CPK at the Stanford Shopping Center after an appointment one afternoon. If you're ever in the mood for CPK, DON'T go to this one. It's not that clean. Our table felt sticky and it still smelled like the rags that they clean the table with. Yuck. Service was also meh. The one on Cowper is so much better since it's clean and there's more room to sit and breathe.  We also ordered some Spring Rolls for appetizers. Half were Thai Chicken (Peanut sauce, bean sprouts, scallions, carrots, cilantro and Mozzarella. Served with peanut sauce) and the other half were Mediterranean Veggie (Wild mushrooms, eggplant, sun-dried tomatoes, caramelized onions, Mozzarella and Parmesan. Served with marinara). Pictured above are the veggie ones, which I surprisingly preferred.  Anyway, I got the Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza and split it with two others. It has Chipotle adobo sauce, shaved poblanos, Monterey Jack with house-made roasted corn & black bean salsa, cilantro and lime crema. One of my favorites now on their menu since there's flavor and spice. I wish they still had the Tandoori chicken one like back in the day!

I usually love this place, but I recently went there last weekend just for a quick lunch.  When my mom and I first walked in and asked for a table, one of the hosts was quick to find a table and seat us but then one of the other co workers did not want them to seat us there so they were bickering in the front.  Next they sat us next to the door when it was a cold windy day and every time someone opened up the door we would get a gust of cold air so we decided to ask for another table that we saw open. The food was decent, and service was very slow.  We had to ask multiple times for our waters to be refilled and the waiter never once came back to check on how our food was doing.   As for the hosts, I could not enjoy my lunch because I was constantly bothered by how unprofessional they are.  One of the hosts was charging her phone and sitting on the bench, the other two were not paying attention at all to customers as they walked in  and were just talking and flirting.  When the next group of hosts came in for a shift change all of them were up at the front with there backs turned talking very loudly.  They were rude and disrespectful.  Might want to consider hiring people who actually want to work and help people instead of standing around doing nothing.

Definitely not what it was the first time. It's been a whole since I've been here and it's clear things have changed.  The food wasn't very good, salad was kinda old (Lettuce was almost brown). The pizza was just kinda ok. Nothing special.  The employees weren't friendly at all. When you asked them for something they have you that, ugh I don't care about you, look.  Employees were more interested in talking than serving or refilling drinks.  Definitely different from my last 5 star review of this place!
Great pizza! We enjoyed all our dishes. Very thin and crispy pizza, even better with the peach salad!

I ordered take-out, a margueritta pizza, and it just wasn't good. In fact, it was among the worst pizzas I've had.. It tastes much worse than comparable pizza chains like Pizza Hut or Donino's, which are much much better. If you're into fast food chains, you might think this place is all-right, but even in the world of fast food chains, I would rate this very low. I wouldn't recommend going here, the pizza has such a ready-made taste, and I personally found it difficult to stomach.

The SERVICE and FOOD are TERRIBLE!  The ladies who helped the seating crossed out our name from the wait list without even calling our name! We were just sitting next to the counter! If we did not notice the group after us got seated, we would probably keep waiting like a idiot! We finally got seated and ordered a California Fields Salad, a spaghetti and a Sicilian pizza. The salad and spaghetti were good. However, the pizza was not hot enough, like it's been sitting outside for 5-10 min!!! We told the waiter and he brought it back to oven to reheat it. When it was brought back, the meat on the top were over-heated and too dry and crust were chewy. We just had a frozen CPK pizza last weekend and the frozen one even taste better!! At least it's hot and crust is not chewy!!! I DO NOT RECOMMEND this place and will not come back again!!!

The pork on the taco is very salty.  The garlic cream fettuccine is one of the best I've tasted. The front hostesses can use a smile. Ordered spinach dip but they didn't provide side plates & spoon. They didn't provide spoon for salsa. My cranberry drink was empty but they didn't refill it. I'm giving 3 stars because of the pasta.

When we first arrived, it was freezing. We asked to have the AC lower, and asked again and again and again . At the end of our meal, we were freezing despite wearing jackets, in July!! 5 min after being served, our waiter asked if we were done and we needed boxes to take leftovers! And she came back twice during our meal to ask the same question! Then, while eating, we received the check although we didn't requested it yet! I would never go back to this restaurant! So unwelcoming!

Service could be better and that is putting it mildly  ... Food ok although I would have appreciated if they use a little less spice and salt in their food .Most importantly please ...please tell us if u can't accommodate a request before you get food for the rest of the party and 1 person waits at the table for his food . Desserts were nice although they really take their own sweet time (pun intended) Oh yeah at least ask if we are done before you give us the cheque ...you don't do while I am still eating my entree.

I've been to numerous California Pizza Kitchens , this place was hopping on  Saturday night. People were waiting to get in. Luckily, we were only two people and able to sit at the bar. The bartender was great! He was a little overwhelmed and very busy, but took our order and the food was great. We had Chinese chicken salad, chicken garlic pizza and chocolate and caramel sundae( some of these items are not on the menu, but they were willing to accomodate us).

Consistently great customer service, quick turnaround, and delicious food.  Kevin and Savannagh (sp?) were very attentive to our needs, coming around frequently to check up on us.   White Corn Guacamole:  The kid's all time favorite did not disappoint.  It was gone before I could sample it! Original BBQ Chicken:  The kids shared this which was more than enough.  There were leftovers for me!  Good chew packed with good flavor. Jambalaya Fettuccine:  I normally don't order pasta anywhere due to the carbs but I wasn't "feeling" my go to Moroccan Spiced Chicken salad.  It turned out to be a good choice.  It was a generous portion: i ended up taking half of it home.  The spice level was subtle which is a good thing for a chain restaurant.  Kevin thought ahead by dropping off the red pepper flakes in case I wanted to take it to the "next level".  The pasta had a nice chew and there were tons of shrimp.  That was another surprise.   We were there last night (Thursday) around 7pm and the wait was not very long (10 mins).

I came here because everywhere else was super packed and crowded. It's safe to say I probably won't come here again. I ordered the garlic alfredo with shrimp. The pasta was a little heavy but the shrimp was too salty and threw off the taste of the rest of the dish. I would not recommend coming back here again.

It didn't impress but it didn't disappoint either. The waitress was super friendly and new the menu like the back of her hand. I ordered tacos that we okay. Like 3 1/2 stars would be adequate. I order the fish tacos and was expecting more of authentic flavors. It's more of a closes law and BBQ fish feel to it. They are good, just not what I was expecting. It was a little on the pricey side too. I didn't expect to pay that much and still leave hungry. I know their pizza is great, just skip pass those tacos.

Service was okay. The food on the other hand was just gross. I ordered a chop barbecue chicken salad which is supposed to be a CPK favorite well let me say the meat was runny, chewy and raw looking.  The waiter assured  me that the meat was fully cooked it was barbecue chicken out of the tube just kidding but he did say that if you ordered anything from CPK he orders grilled chicken instead of the regular chicken which is disgusting. I ordered a caramelized peach salad which is good as long as you didn't have any type of meat involved the salad was great that's all I can say waiter was nice.  The pizza we had was really bad. Hawaiian. The cheese wasn't that great on it, and the toppings are just so so. It just wasn't a fantastic tasting pizza as I was expecting. I would figure a big chain like this would produce a quality product consistently.  And on very simple items.  Anyhow, will not be on my list of places to go again in Stanford shopping center. 2 star for the meat being so processed. 14 dollar salad should come with grilled "real" meat in my opinion and not some processed packaged meat.

I went here for black Friday and they seemed to be fairly busy . I really enjoyed the egg roll appetizer.  Our server was jair. I think I spelt the name wrong but he was very attentive and funny so the wait was fine.  I ordered the bbq chichen pizza and it was plenty. I like this location because of the atmosphere.   I will return.

Went here with my wife and daughter after getting pictures with Santa at the Stanford Center and all I can say is meh... It was a rainy day so the outside tables were not being used. Their inside space is cramped with almost no waiting area. My wife found her spaghetti to be a little too salty, my daughter's cheese pizza was....a cheese pizza. Our complimentary bread was delivered with a mumbled explanation about 3/4 or the way thru the meal. I got the creamy garlic pasta and for $3 had them add chicken which amounted to 8 (I counted them) measly chunks of chicken. They were hard to find being the same color of the cream sauce and pasta. I moved the chicken to the side and asked the waiter " so this is $3 of chicken?". His concerned reply...."yeah". So I say meh... The place is cramped and the meals are not a good value for the $$$. Won't be coming here ever again.

The food quality is consistent across the country. So, if I traveled to some place where no restaurants interested me, or if I am in the shopping mall in need of a quick but satisfying lunch, I would choose this restaurant for some Mushroom ravioli, I know it will always taste good. They also have a great selection. The service is always good.

Haven't been to CPK in 15 years and this place was crowded so I thought, how bad can it be? I was so wrong. Chinese chicken salad (1 star) - WORST EVER. They should be embarrassed that they serve this on the menu. It was a complete pile of mush. Horribly soggy lettuce with some wet sauce on top along with a few chunks of chicken. Felt like it was made a long time and that's why it was so soggy. Were they were known for this once?!? Pizza (3 stars) - dough and crust were fine with a crisp outside but chewy texture inside. But nothing to write home about. Service was very nice thankfully as the only saving grace. Bottom line: If this food is representative of all CPKs, I don't know how they stay in business.

I must say that I am surprised that I liked this place as much as I did. We stayed with a simple menu choice this time and it came out very good: a 1/2 Cobb Salad and a Pepperoni Pizza. The salad had really smokey bacon and was very good for a Cobb. The pizza turned out perfect: a real NY style pizza with a thin crust that had the perfect chew, the right amount of cheese and a peppery pepperoni. Could not have asked for a better light combo.  The crowd was pretty heavy and we chose to eat at the right end of the counter, where we had a great view of the ovens baking the pizzas and crusty bread loafs, the meals coming out and being finished for serving. What became apparent is that this is a hard working team that were actively serving all the dishes for the rest of the dining room.  We only saw one pizza cooling longer than we were comfortable with, thinking "oh that cooled pizza's coming back" but it was waiting for the rest of the entrees to come out before it was finally served. If that's the case, i would have specified to the wait staff that the pizza should be served immediately and not wait for the rest of the items. Overall, the service was attentive and friendly, the food we ordered (and a few that we drooled over when we saw it ready for serving) was really good and we very much enjoyed it. If the selection is simple and the pizza is all you want, this might be just the spot in a very busy mall.

I'm sad to say that I can't recommend this place anymore. It's been my experience - on several occasions - that CPK doesn't open on time. Instead of 11 it's 11-ish. But maybe a few minutes late, despite seeing the line forming outside. However, today I left. I walked away. It was cold. We'd been waiting almost 10 minutes after 11. And they were just standing inside. Taking pictures of each other. While looking outside at us rubes standing and waiting for them to open the door. So, I left. I went next store to Yucca (which has a nice GF menu BTW). I will not frequent CPK again. If they have this much visible disdain for their customers, I shudder to think about what they do when we can't see what they really think of us. (p.s. I'm going to send this message to corporate. I hope whomever made the decision to take selfies rather than take care of customers might learn a bit of a lesson. But maybe not.)

This location has a great atmosphere. Unfortunately; that brings long lines. The food was great and our server never missed a beat. The only complaint I have is that they charge for plain old soda water as if I was guzzling cokes through my lunch. Otherwise, a great location and better food.

Just went here with 5 tweens for a birthday dinner.  We were very impressed with the service and the food quality.  Our server, Jorge, was especially attentive even though most of the table was ordering kids' meals.  There was something for everyone on the kids' menu and I really enjoyed the bbq chicken salad.     Can't wait to come back.

I have tried ordering different entrees to give this place a chance cause of the convenient curbside pick up but not so satisfied with their food because even If I specifically state medium spicy they make the food extra spicy I could not eat it at all. This is sad cause this place use to be my go to place at Westwood and and when I lived in LA. I give it 2 stars for the memory of what it use to be.

The food is really really good. Their ingredients are always very fresh. For the customer service I can't say anything bad. Our server was Jorge, he was very outgoing, present and anticipating our needs. He even joked a little bit with us, he was like I expect a server to be. Being french and uses to a french service, its very important for me that the server is smilley, funny, polite and present. I really like to sit on the patio, very sunny!

Really good ravioli! An info session review :D I had the food from the pizza kitchen at a college info session otherwise called a free food event. They had four cheese ravioli and kung pao spaghetti. The ravioli was really good and sufficiently cheesy and the flavor of the sauce was really good. I  wasn't a fan of the kung pao spaghetti though. I didn't like the idea of kung pao flavor with spaghetti.  There was also salad. Loved the dip.  I will probably go check this place out sometime , in person.
Love CPK! I always get the margarita pizza and BBQ chicken chopped salad with extra BBQ sauce and avocado!  It's seriously the best!!!  Will come here again!

The food here was so satisfying.  Went here when I was starving and they beought out the avacado egg rolls promptly and it was delicious.  The Sicilian Pizza was so tasty. My bf and I recieved great service from the servers and food runners. Definitely will be returning.

Cpk is always the restaurant of choice when we are at Stanford mall.  The variety of food choice fit everyone in our family.  Kids love their fusilli. Granny loves their soup and noodle. We love their salad. The servers are friendly.  Nice restaurant for the family. Only thing- the waiting time can be quite long on weekends.
I had the best service ever here! coming from a server it means a lot. Yair did a great job and our food was perfect.  I will come back again!

Jambalaya pasta blew me away. I hate pizza and was dreading to come here but I was so impressed with their pasta and caramelized peach salad... Cant wait to be back! Second time coming: Tried something new, their chicken tequila pasta, I forgot the full name but it was yummers! And my friend got their Hawaiian pizza  and it was really good too! I always sit outside and service has been pretty good.

We have gone to this location several times and normally have a good experience. The servers are friendly, food comes out relatively quickly, and is normally prepared to order. Today was an off day, but we will be thinking twice prior to going again. Our order took a very long time to come out and was not only incorrect, but dishes we order often did not taste good at all. We were in a hurry so we were unable to have things remade as it took so long to come out, but the waitress made comments about knowing it came out incorrect and delivered it anyway. Like I said, normally pretty good and great location, but today was disappointing and unsure if we will go back.

First of all there was extreme confusion on the waiter's part about pizzas with gluten free crusts. Then he brings us dirty plates....twice. Our Cobb Salad came undressed. Our spinach dip was good. The pizza cane and it was cold. The texture of the crust was like styrofoam. The crust was still frozen. The bathroom after 30 minutes after opening was all out of toilet seat covers. Obviously won't be going back.
Loved John on the patio!! Highly recommend his section for an afternoon lunch. John was so, so nice to us and we enjoyed our pizza!
Wonderful service! Kevin and Tino were so helpful when I came with two 89 year olds! Plus, the food was great. The Bianca flatbread with sage was delicious and even though a small plate, was a meal!

we were able to get in right at closing time.  we were a party of 7 and they were still able to seat us and get our order right.  the pizzas were good, nothing extraordinary.  the pastas looked good too but again, nothing extraordinary.

0 star for customer service. Negative rating if I can! I am a long-time CPK patron and our family loves coming to CPK. On 4/12/15, however, we had the most unpleasant experience with CPK stanford of my life.  We arrived at the CPK at 1:30 and was told to put down our names and the wait time would be 15 mins. We sat by the front desk and waited patiently. At 2:10, I saw parties that arrived much much later than us were getting seated and went to the front desk and asked about our table.  The girl calling the parties misspelled our name, but never called  even the misspelled name, and skipped our table. So 15 parties after us got seated, and we were still sitting next to her waiting to be called.  This girl with heavy eye makeup offered no apology whatsoever, and when the server (manager?) came to lead us to our table, she immediately started bad mouthing us in front of her coworker and other customers loudly--to the point that I can hear her calling us out!!! This is the most disgusting experience I have ever had in any restaurant, including fast food chains. CPK stanford -- your customer service training is appallingly inadequate, and your front desk staff needs an attitude adjustment. I don't believe I have the appetite to return to CPK ever again.  I had some good times at CPK, but won't miss them. When I see the palm tree logo of yours, all I can think of is that you hire people who are mean, rude, and unapologetic. Too bad. All you need is one bad experience to cut out a restaurant from your life.

Be careful when ordering to go. They l've always gotten my order wrong. Incomplete actually. When you order something "on the side," make sure it gets packed before you leave. I hate to write a bad review, but every time my family wants to order from CPK, I cringe, 'cause I know something will get left out. But that would be my biggest complaint. Order a salad- crispy noodles on the side. Brownie a la mode. Bread & olive oil for 6 ppl..... Before i walked away I realized the noodles weren't packed, neither was the ice cream or bread. Basically everything I asked for on the side. And this happens every single time.
Great outdoor seating option! Love their seasonal watermelon salad but they don't have the lobster flat bread and only offer at valley fair location....

I know this a chain restaurant.. But I feel like every restaurant is different from the managers, workers, food and atmosphere. I went in for dinner after work during the Warriors final game 1. I know they were busy but our waiter was really attentive and remembered everything I requested. Cpk has one of my favorite salads which is the Bbq chicken salad with avocado. It's pretty pricey but worth it. And I always get there egg rolls. Amazing!!  One thing I got to say is that since I was waiting for a seating inside they said it was going to be a 15 min. And so I gave the host my name and said I was gonna be back. When I got back she said she gave my table away?? Like, do you not remember which conversation we had...
I had their margarita pizza, and thought it was just average. I did, however like the thin crust they used. Service can definitely use some improvement.
Zero star customer service!! The servers at the front were just talking to each other instead of helping us and offered the worse table/counter. We just decided to leave immediately.

We arrived at 3:30 PM. Our party had 4 adults and 2 children. We were told the wait would be for 20 minutes.   After 30 minutes, the restaurant was about 1/4 empty ( I counted) yet we were still waiting. None of the tables were being bused and I counted at least 4 to 6 workers who were visibly standing there doing nothing but talking to each other. I asked if we were going to be seated soon and they replied that  the customers were taking longer than normal. I spotted a large table that I thought my  party was going to sit at. It took about 15 minutes for the table to be cleaned and readied after the table was empty. And the restaurant was still about 1/4 empty. There were lots of workers but they were very inefficient. Total time was 45 minutes of waiting! Four stars for the food, zero stars for customer service.
Great customer service. I've been going there for 3 years and always happy with the food and the service.  Very busy during lunch time but I always find an empty chair in the bar area.

Came in on a Thursday around 6 and only waited 5 minutes (for a table for 3).  Were a little wary from reading previous reviews about this place and their service but we ended up having a great experience.   Our server, Chloe, was very attentive and friendly yet professional; she refilled our glasses frequently and promptly took empty dishes back.  We were very pleased and grateful.  Also appreciated that another waitress or manager was roaming to check on tables and offered to refill my iced tea I had quickly downed.  Complimentary bread is served and we tried a flatbread appetizer which we all enjoyed.  The three pizzas we ordered were perfect and appropriately sized for the price - left no room for dessert.  Noticed lots of menu options. Our table area was clean and kept cool, but there was a large group of 20 young businessmen meeting outside on the patio and remained standing so part of our window space was blocked by three backsides which was kind of awkward and funny. Overall: great food, great service, will definitely return!

We tried another of their locations in another city and since we liked it there we decided to try them at the shopping center and we were not disappointed. We had that salad with some roasted vegetables and additionally a chicken breast  or half I should say on it. The salad was excellent. We had two of their pizzas which were very good. Another family member had a sandwich and soup. They were accommodating and mad a change for here which we really appreciated. The service was fast and friendly. It was the perfect day to sit outside and we really enjoyed it.

We had CPK provide us appetizers for Happy Hour last Friday!  Such a big hit!!  It was perfect food to pair with beer!!!  We ordered via Restaurants on the Run, so everything was on time for our party.  The food was presented well and still tasted great for all of our hungry staff members that stuck around for Happy Hour!

This location is always packed. Waited 35 min to b seated, got drinks and time went by, 25 min later our waiter comes by and says I just realized I FORGOT to take your order, didn't even apologized and he checked on us ONCE after that! Over all good food, HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!

I was not looking forward to another meal at a chain restaurant especially on the rare occasion that I was at Stanford Shopping Center.  But my niece insisted on eating here so I gave in.  We were very promptly seated within 5 minutes which was good.  Our server/waiter spoke with a heavy accent but he was attentive and helpful.  The food was CPK okay.  Maybe a bit better than my local branch of this ubiquitous chain.  But it is Palo Also so one should expect the best.  I haven't been back to Palo Alto since I graduated HS 20 years ago.  I was surprised at the mostly Asian yuppie clientele at CPK.  All in all, it was a pleasant lunch and at $36 for two, it's not bad at all.

We go Stanford shopping center a lot w/ our dog and here is where we'd go for restaurant because they have outdoor sittings which allows dogs under table. This is a chain restaurant so food is as expected, no good no bad. It's just when you are wanting to eat w/ your dog buddy, come in and sit, finish, on leash and continue spend one of the brilliant days you together will have. Weekend is bit line here, 15mins tops for us (wife and me and dog for outdoor).

Ordered the Spinach Artichoke Pizza, Arugula Asparagus Salad, and Mac and Cheese Fried Balls. Their mac and cheese fried balls are to die for and better than Cheesecake Factory's. All the food was really good and the staff was really attentive. My favorite CPK in the country.!
This place is awesome the pizza great, drinks taste and the service great defenetly coming back!!!!

To be fair, I need to preface my review with the fact that I did order my meal via  . That being said, the cedar plank salmon was horrible! It was dry and burnt. The Ceasar salad wasn't any better with wilted and soggy lettuce.  I've always liked CPK, but this meal was an utter fail. Will think twice about trying them again...
The saving grace is the flat bread,  it is like two pieces of pizza.  The soup is like bean paste!
Nice fast and good service! Great place for a quick lunch or dinner before the Stanford Game !

Great food! Great service! And the ambiance lighting was perfect. We enjoyed there appetizer which was the flat bread with melted mozzarella  cheese, feta and basil. Highly recommend it. we ordered their "works" and wasn't disappointed one bit. Charisse was amazing and was on point keeping the water and drinks coming along with napkins which most places never do! Will definitely be coming back. They also have a great bar if you enjoying have a cocktail. I know I'll definitely order their honey walnut feta salad next time.

CPK is CPK. Wherever one goes.  This location is pretty consistently busy, often with a moderate wait.  The food is CPK. Solid, fancier style pizzas, good salads.  We often get one pizza and one salad and share them between my husband and I.  Our usuals (if you can call it that - we come here about once ever six months) are: The white pizza with added bacon - I think the bacon makes the pizza. Don't neglect it if you order the white pizza!  The Thai Crunch salad with avocado instead of chicken. Again, the rich, buttery avocado really makes the salad for me.  Everything I've had here is consistent and good, and the service is good too. I struggle with giving it any higher than 3 stars because I can't say "yay I'm a fan." But I do enjoy this place now and again, so I'm going for the full 4 stars.

Saturday night I visited the restaurant after 7PM with my girlfriend. When we walked in it was busy and people were in line. They told us that two people were ahead of us and that we would have to wait for 25 minutes. I took a walk and then I went back to check 25 minutes later. The lady then told me that three people were ahead of us so, politely, I made sure she knew that arithmetic is not an opinion. 15 minutes later we were seated. I looked through the menu and I could not really find anything particularly enticing. I had pizza at lunch and I ended up choosing pizza for dinner as well when I decided to try an original BBQ chicken pizza. The pizza itself was good and flavorful but nothing out of the ordinary. Later on I ordered a Belgian chocolate soufflé cake which I was expecting to be softer because a soufflé should be soft but it was very much like a brownie which is something that I don't really go crazy for anyway. Jorge was our waiter. He was very polite and courteous, even sarcastic but in a good way. He often came back to check on us. The food we ate was decent but, honestly, this place does not elevate cooking in any manner. It's just another restaurant that belongs to an overrated chain. I find the menu restricted and I don't see anything glorious about eating at California Pizza Kitchen.
Really love it here. Not only is that pizza great but salads are super tasty. The pasta dishes are very yummy and I found the staff to be great. Really enjoy it here!

Planned to try this since we haven't for years.. We got inside and the receiver gal wasn't so enthusiastic and if I didn't say a word she wouldn't even greet us. She waited for us to talk when it should be her as the receptionist to initiate to the guests. She shouldn't be there for that job and having her there is already a downfall. She mumbled & couldnt be heard. she asked if we wanted inside or outside so we chose outside coz it was livelier there. Then we waited for the server to get out order for about 20 mins. Too long of a wait considering there wasnt much crowd that time. Another downfall. We ordered salad for the price of 11.99 each and when it came to us, it was OK but as we tasted it, something's missing. We were just kinda hungry so we ended up finishing it . But, the salad wasn't worth the price considering we've tried a lot of salads from diff restaurants but this was the worst and the most expensive ones considering the ones we tried in the past were fine class dining.. We the lettuce was hard to nibble, the salad was dry with uneven cut of chicken, no taste, their mango lemon drink wasnt mango taste, they just added yelllow orange to make it look like mango, basically the issue was the salad could have been worth the price .. You can even find 6.99 salad from groceries that taste much better than California Pizza's 11.99-15.99 salad which is bland hard and dry... Their overpricing menu is not worth it... They shld just stick with pizza selection if they can't meet other standards... You can also see 3 other tables with left over plates, goes to show different customers fr diff tables also left unsatisfied...We did not leave a tip.. we werent served better, food was poor , reception was a fail, unhappy customers = no tip If this salad represents the whole place, I don't know how they can still stay in business

This post is not about the food. CPK always has good eats. I am just very disappointed in seeing a dog allowed to sit in an infant seat, dirty butt hole and all. Those are chairs I have my infant son sit in - well not any more. Poor decision making on the servers. I left before the dog did so who knows if the chair was wiped down and disinfected.

Normally, I would never write a review about this chain but this one evening was just horrible so I've decided to write about it. Two Saturday nights ago, my best friend and I came to this location for dinner. As well as to catch up. We walked in and the waiting area was over crowded of people waiting for a table. I walked up and put my name in, I was told it would be a 45 minute wait to sit inside. Agreeing, I looked around at the bar but there were only scattered empty seats. We waited aimlessly at the bar but it seemed no one wanted to move. My friend and I walked back to the waiting area where the hostess was trying to get people to eat outside in 50 degree weather. Even with heat lamps most turned her down. While I was waiting I almost slipped on their sticky floor twice and to be honest someone should have cleaned that. It's a hazard and if I would have fallen I would've be a happy campier. Still waiting for our table my friend and I could tell that the hostess was over worked and hadn't had a break. I truly felt sorry for her, you could tell she was overworked and needed someone to relieve her for a break. Finally, forty minutes later we were seated at a table. We waited five minutes which wasn't bad and a woman came to take our order for drinks. The waitress informed us that a gentleman would be taking over our table for her. The waiter came back with our drinks then we asked for a minute to order. As we still trying to make a decision with our order a couple gets seated two tables from us.
