The young man comes back and we order. Moments later he comes back with bread then leans across the table and starts discussing my friends tattoos. She was sweet enough to tell him then he kept staring at her. Just as he left, I saw the manager call him over and yell at him. Apparently, while he was flirting with my friend the couple two tables left in disgust. Now, I work in customer service myself and there is one thing you never do is yell at someone on the floor. Feeling a bit uncomfortable, I finish eating my bread and my friend stack our plates to let him know we're done with the bread. My friend asked for more so he went back for more. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw him come out of the kitchen with the bread. He drops a piece and kicks it to the side. Seriously? Come on! That's another hazard because someone could slip on it and fall. Our waiter comes back and give us back our dirty plates. No offense but he could have asked us if we wanted to use them before taking them or brought us new ones. Gross!! Thank goodness, our food finally comes and we start to finally enjoy. By the end of the end, I'm happy to get out of there. Never in my life have I experienced service so bad there. First of all that place needs more seating inside for cold days/nights such as that. Second, I thought the service was a bloody joke. I will not be returning to this location again.

Food was OK... The usual California Pizza kitchen fare even though my chicken Milanese did not have any olives on it as advertised on the menu. Service was sub-par. We had hungry children with us and we were never brought bread even though the tables around us were. The bread would have helped! Also the servers at the tables surrounding ours were quite friendly while ours seemed to have a chip on her shoulder. We will likely try a different place next time we shot at Stanford mall.

My experience here was pretty good. It was busy, and I thought we would have to wait, but we came and they glady seated us at our table. Our server was on point always checking in to see if we were OK refills and whatever we wanted. All in all this place gets four stars for their customer service and their food is very good.

Absolutely horrendous experience here. I already do not think very highly of this location, but I gave them the benefit of the doubt tonight. However, I did not think it was possible for a restaurant to give me so much anger, anxiety and frustration, but this location made it look easy. I wasted over an hour of my time at this location and going back and forth tonight. First off, my order took forever to be made. Then once it's ready to be consumed, they totally forgot two entrees. I had to waste another 20 minutes driving back to get the entrees that should have been included in the first place, especially given the ridiculous amount of time that was had in getting it to me correct. Outside of my own experience tonight, the takeout line was full of angry people, including a woman who was way overcharged for her order and had waited a ridiculously long time for it as well. At this point, I'm just going to avoid this location and only deal with other pizzerias around Palo Alto.

i recently discovered CPK through a giftcard I got for christmas. this place serves the best I have ever had their BBQ chicken is soooo good. Or maybe I just haven't eaten enough pizzas lol . The place is kind of small but it is still well kept and cozy. The staff was great as well. When I feel like dishing out the $$ I'll probably come back here again.
I hate this location. Food is always overcooked. Anything fried shows signs of cooks not cleaning out the oil. Won't go back.

We've been coming regularly for several years, and the food and service have consistently been good.  Back when my mom was still with us, they were patient and respectful of her specific requests.  They've also accommodated our requests for well-cooked pasta (the boy doesn't like his noodles Al dente).  On Sunday's, they can get pretty busy, and the wait can be long.  Come early, or on a weekday.  Good stuff.

This CPK is a regular pit stop for me and my mom whenever we come to Palo Alto to shop, so I pretty much know what I'm getting myself into every time. We usually split a Thai Crunch Salad, but we opted for the "Lite Adventures" section of the menu this time. I had the Shrimp Scampi and she had the Cedar Plank Salmon. The food was actually very good especially considering we ordered off the "under 650 cals" section.  The service was less than phenomenal. I do have a litany of complaints, but I'm not so ridiculous that I expect 5 star service from a CPK lol, so I'll leave it at that :)

I typically love CPK and today in particular, I was craving it. I figured I would order it online and take it home via curbside after shopping. I've ordered a full size Waldorf Chicken 100x before, so I usually know what to expect. They gave it to me and I went on my way 35 miles away. Once I got home, I was MORTIFIED. There were 3, BITE SIZE pieces of chicken (maybe 2 in at best), about 7 pieces of apple, one blue cheese chunk and maybe about 10 grapes. I absolutely CANNOT BELIEVE I paid $16 plus a $2 tip for basically lettuce. I question whether they skimp on curbside folks because they can't complain in person. I know what this salad is normally supposed to be like and they obviously cut me WAY short. Shame on them. Total rip off.

okay, so I Love this place. when it's some Other CPK. like, Emeryville, or in SoCal. not this one. lunch run-I order a half salad at 12:30. I'm still standing there at 12:54, because apparently there was a stall in the garden patch outside to create my supremely difficult-to-cultivate salad I ordered. at least that was my hope, as I stood there and watched orders After me walk out.  since I'm across the street from the job, I am trying to not act starved, and more importantly, Ignored. once my order is up, And after I threw a mild hissy, They want to get the manager (even though my extended presence was acknowledged maybe 10 mins before-meaning 10 to 15 minutes into a salad order to go) and I'm thinking, 'Tha hell was the manager 5 minutes ago when you all finally Made my salad?' so I said that. finally got to start on my now-dinner, and there's no chicken in it. $18 bucks, 24 minutes I can't get back and a promise to walk past this one to The Melt, where They don't treat you like you paid with pennies. this is not my first bad experience at this one, and I ain't buying the whole 'lunch rush' excuse when everybody else got their lunch, both before and 5 people (I had time to count) after me.  and that salted caramel thing? it's like a food project for 3rd graders.

We ordered a Sicilian pizza and a salad with two soft drinks. The food was good, it was just the service that justifies the poor review.  We arrived on a Saturday night and were seated immediately. Placed our order and the server asked if we wanted the salad first, we said yes. While we waited for our drinks a party of two in front of us, who arrived after, received their drink and complementary bread then appetizer before we got our drinks. The server was a different person, mind you. While we continued to wait, the server continuously approached an adjacent table but neglected to bring our drinks. Finally our drinks came, then a few minutes later our salad came then our pizza arrived within 1 minute. No fret though, as we were famished from a long Saturday. While we began to touch the salad the server approached us to ask how the food was--that was the last time we would interact with him until the check.  That brings me back to the adjacent table. The server continued to come back, and back, and back to them but neglected us. I had finished my soft drink quickly into our dinner but was not asked if I wanted a refill until we were asked if we wanted a dessert or boxes.  I did not confront the waiter as the adjacent table was a family of four with two young children and did not want to ruin their dinner when ours was already tarnished. I decided to write my frustration on the receipt.

I have been to many CPK because my kids love it. My first time at this location and it's been the worst experience I've had at a CPK! 90% of the staff look miserable and are not friendly at all. Our waitress wouldn't even acknowledge the kids and another kicks the door that we are sitting next to the outside  open angry.   The food was decent, the only reason I'm giving 2 stars but I could not finish it because during the meal I became parched and I needed a refill on my beverage which I never received.  Very disappointed

I just love their deep-fried mac & cheese and I love their jambalaya. Pizza could be a hit or miss sometimes but I do have a bias against weak pizza with limited toppings. I also really enjoyed the staff never had a problem and they've always been very very friendly. Best of all I do like the location in Stanford shopping center.

+ Pizza recommendations:  1) Habanero Carnitas (served with a super pink, super spicy habanero sauce). I actually preferred the pizza without adding the sauce because it was so spicy and had me chugging water. Really wish I had more pain tolerance because it was very tasty!  2) Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage 3) Sicilian (thin crust) 4) Meat cravers (thin crust) I've tried the Original BBQ pizza as well, but I've learned I'm not a big sweet pizza person (aside from Hawaiian, maybe), so I wouldn't choose it over these 4. I also did prefer the original pizzas to their thin crust pizzas -- personal preference though.   + Waldorf salad: I'm biased here because this is one of my favorite types of salads, but it was really good! I do wish the "full salad" portion were bigger -- I came with a group of 3 and we definitely could have had more.  + Portion sizes: I came in a group of 3 hungry people and we ordered 2 pizzas and a salad.  - Wait time: It's usually long without a reservation, so I'd make one if possible. Both times I've come so far for dinner, the wait has probably been around 20-30 minutes. Service is also unfortunately pretty slow, but thankfully they do serve a bread plate to get you started. Ask for it if your server doesn't bring it! One time (when we were particularly hungry :P), the server brought it with our meal, so my guess is he might have forgotten...

I visited this particular location of CPK as I went to the Apple Store to pick up something that I had ordered two months ago.  It was the first time that I had chosen to eat here. Great experience and great food.

i've been to cpk many times, but only twice to this particular location.  the most recent visit was with a group of 13 to celebrate a special occasion.  i was able to easily reserve a table, and the staff re-confirmed the party that afternoon, but i was a bit disappointed that the table was not yet ready when i arrived, a few minutes before the scheduled reservation.  fortunately, it didn't take long to set up the table, and before long, we were seated at our patio table next to some heat lamps, suitable for a somewhat chilly night. i ordered a small bbq chicken salad, which turned out to be a rather large salad with grilled chicken, black beans, jicama, diced tomatoes, and bbq sauce.  i had requested no cheese and tortilla strips, with dressing on the side to keep the salad healthier.  for $10.99, this portion was definitely generous, but the taste was more or less average. from a service perspective, our waiter did a fantastic job taking care of our large party, from the drink & appetizer orders to our specific entrees, as many of us had specific dietary restrictions/requests.  he even remembered to let us know about the cake that was sitting in the back, waiting to be presented to the guest of honor.  and with our signal, he brought out the extra plates and forks, as well as the boxed cake.  i really applaud him for tending to each and every one of our needs as it is not easy with a party of 13 with so many specific requests! definitely a great place to host a group special occasion as they have the real estate to accommodate larger parties.  the heat lamps make it suitable even for a winter occasion. i'll definitely be back the next time i need a comfort food restaurant to host a group function!

I came in on a slow day and there were a lot of open seats. I was greeted by an un-enthused hostess who was checking out her manicure. She seated me, and I waited for 15 minutes without anyone asking if I wanted anything to drink or if I was ready to order. I watched as two waiters were standing against the wall, chatting, and looked at my table. I gestured to them, but they continued their conversation. Goodbye forever, Stanford CPK. Your food isn't even that good. I'll just go over to Yucca where the service is always amazing.

CPK... Chain restaurant means you know what to expect. Only thing that might change is service.  We came on a big ole Monday afternoon. The one thing I appreciate is the managers on duty are always walking the floor and assisting at this location.  The waitress were were responsive, we received bread without asking and water. We ordered wine, bianco (a little crispy, but I liked it), the wedge, and fish tacos. $60 bill a little much for lunch, but worth it.
I ordered the grilled vegetable salad and it was fresh and it had a lot of vegetables. The dressing made it even better. The service was quick and attentive. I'll be back.
Nice people working here, all the standard California Pizza Kitchen foods, menu recently updated- has some nice things. Enjoyable!
The food was excellent, but our server Hugo sucks. It took him 45 mins to come to our table to ask how was our food and needed anything else. No eye contact and bad services.
The salads used to be very good at some point. Recently I got a grilled vegie and it has no taste or flavors and was very ordinary.

Something is very wrong at this place. We've liked and ordered their pizza for years but last night we ordered via Door Dash a thin crust Sicilian. Delivery time, etc., was great as usual. But when the pizza arrived, it had virtually no cheese, very little tomato sauce,  and a ton of cayenne pepper. We each took one bite, looked at each other, and agreed, "Let's toss it." We threw the entire thing away. I called and complained to Mark, the manager, who said, "Thank you for your feedback." I said he had better keep a closer eye on the pies that are leaving his establishment if he wants to keep his customers, and hung up before he could offer me a free pizza. We will NEVER order from this establishment again.

I've eaten at CPK before but not at this location.  The inside is nice and bright ( I hate not being able to see what I'm eating ).  The service was great.  The manager even came over to say hello and gave me a card for a free flat bread for being a first time customer.  Their moscow mules were delicious and all the food was delicious.  Half a Caesar salad was more than enough plus a 5 cheese pizza (noms!).  And if you are at the bar, have Stephanie make your drinks.  She's a great bartender. ;)

The new menu probably has higher prices, and the food quality is going down.  Today's Italian Chopped Salad did not look appetizing with the over-the-hill yellow iceberg lettuce the chef used.  I removed chunks and pieces and mentioned it to server Alexis near the end of the meal.  No manager came by, nothing.  I'm really starting to think about meeting my friends elsewhere for lunch.  This was not worth over $11.

Just horrible service!! I would not ever dine in at this cpk location ever! Our server did not put our order right. She made us wait for the food way more than expected. And then overcharged us for stuff that we did not order.
I tried wild mushroom pizza and really liked it. The dough was great and the toppings were yummy.

Door Dashed an order for 2 Garlic Fettuccine Pasta, however both were very dry as if no sauce. Also, there were spaghetti type noodles included in the dish. Never seen that before. Pretty disappointed considering we paid more than the usual customer because we got it delivered. Not sure if I want to pay the extra for mediocre pasta.
Both food and service were excellent!  My first time at this location was wonderful.  We also joined the e-club and got a free small plate immediately which was nice.  Would definitely go back.

Yikes. Talk about a host of issues.  There was a problem every step of the way at this CPK location including wrong order Shrimp Scampi instead of Lettuce Wraps with Shrimp.  No shaved parmesan on the asparagus arugula salad. Basically NO asparagus on the asparagus arugula salad (one asparagus cut in fours and even the tip was gone!). We were told that they were out of bread and yet we saw other tables getting it, which I pointed out. The bread was finally give to us near the end of dinner.  Apparently they "ran out of smashed pea and barley soup" yet it was only 6 o'clock! I didn't know that was such a popular menu item on a hot day in Palo Alto! Once my soup came at the end of the meal when everyone else was finished, it was so watery, I felt like I was at a soup kitchen. What was weird is the flavor was there just not the insides! I don't even know how they could manage that. The water was never refilled. Our waitress Gloria just seemed like she didn't really care. She acted like she did to our faces but when she turned around, I think she probably made faces at us. We were never rude because I don't believe in that but more challenging: Her: "Sorry, we are out of bread" Me: "really because I see people getting bread" Her: "Oh it just came out of the over".  Me: "SHouldn't mu salad have shaved parmesan", Her,"Yes". Me: "Well, then can I have it because this doesn't have it." Her: "Ok" 10 minutes later, no parmesan.  That sort of thing. Now I know why I rarely eat at CPK. The manager was nice but clueless as to how poorly his staff was at serving people because he came to see how things were and he had to have known because we didn't see him go to anyone else and yet when I said,"Not great" he was like,"Really?" all surprised. I said,"Well that must be why you came by" and he said "no" but I truly think that is why he came by because as I said, I didn't see him go to any other tables. So kudos for checking in but tsk tsk for not owning the lousy service.

Super hungry, this was the first restaurant we encountered along the path so we decided to stop by. This place DOES get crowded even on a Thursday afternoon, when we arrived there was plenty of seating inside and a few more open tables outside, but by the time we left, there was plenty of people waiting.  My friend had the spaghetti with bolognese sauce. She said it was good because she was hungry, but once she was full, it wasn't anything to write home about.  I had the lunch combo ($11) - salad and 7" mushroom, sausage & pepperoni pizza which I think if fair for an average lunch without stuffing yourself. Everything tasted fine, I do wish I could get more croutons, I got TWO. Is there complementary bread and dipping oil? It seemed like everyone around us was getting it but us! I love bread and butter.  Service was above all alright. At the end of lunch, I requested for a small box and forgot to ask for the bill. We had to ask for the bill after the box arrived. Not a big deal, but too bad I couldn't save the waitress an extra trip.

Had the creamy garlic pasta tonight and my mom had the pesto, both with chicken... Delicious . Nice glass of wine and some bread.. Perfect! Cannot wait to go back and try one of their amazing looking pizzas or salads.

It's hit and miss here.  I love the menu. One constant is the waiters walk through the restaurant as though the customers are in their way. I guess I'm old school. My steak was over cooked. Almost dry.

Enjoyed their chicken club sandwich as it was very fresh but I found the chicken to be very bland. Absolutely loved their potato & bacon soup. Their pizza is okay...my poor friend chipped her tooth on their pizza crust so biters beware!
Should be renamed soup and salad kitchen. The pizzas on the menu are on a tiny foldout, no pictures of pizza anywhere. Zero stars.

Review for California pizza kitchen at Stanford mall. Smaller size restaurant, but same delicious food. Service was fast and the pizza and salads were very tasty.  It can get very busy on the weekends so expect a wait. The wait on a sunny Saturday for lunch was 30 minutes. There is indoor and outdoor seating. There is open seating at the bar if you can find a spot.  It is located near the Pottery Barn

Very very very sad to say that the Kung Pao Spaghetti here has changed. It used to be my favorite dish. I don't know if the chef or recipe got switched out but I was very disappointed to get something that tasted like overcooked noodles mixed with a tangy, syrupy barbeque sauce. I didn't want it to go to waste so I ate all I could, problably about half. It used to be much lighter and a perfect amount of spice...what kung pao should taste like. Our artichoke dip was not hot as well.

This location is fairly small so we ended up ordering food to go since it was already after 7 p.m. and we didn't want to wait 20 minutes for a table. The food came out very quickly (only 15 minutes). Everything tasted good, just as we expected. We've eaten at this location twice before and most of the time we call in an order for curbside pick up or we door dash if we absolutely don't want to leave the house.

Good chain restaurant in a busy shopping area. The food is reliable (the thin crust pizzas are the best things on the menu with the Tostada pizza and the pear & gorgonzola pizza among my favorites). The service is also decent. The restaurant is small but the outside seating area allows for more options.

What great service, including hosts & waitress (should have gotten her name so I could include it). I've never given a 5 star before and I'm surprised it's for a 'chain' restaurant. I've been to the CPK in downtown PA which was good but my experience at Stanford was truly commendable. Really yummy  bread and olive oil dip, brought right away to my table. I came with my granddaughter who loved the bread, and then her kids pasta with olive oil (she likes 'healthy') and her request for marinara on the side was graciously provided. I had the delicious Waldorf salad. 1/2 portion was very generous! PLUS we got a free flatbread for signing up for their new rewards program. Really nice flatbread, which I took home because it was too much along with my salad and the complimentary bread provided. Lunch here really completed making our outing to American Girl store special. Thanks, CPK!
Updated for eating a Medal Screw inside the pizza on 11/28/2014. I have done a root canal and permanent Crown on the Tooth #3.  Suffered for almost two years to get uses to eating with a crown.

I've been to several CPKs over the years, and have been to this Stanford Shopping Center restaurant many times.  I recently ordered the Thai Crunch Salad. After ordering the 1/2 size salad, I noticed they put a minimal amount of measured (maybe 1/4 cup) chicken in the salad which was disappointing.  The greens in the salad were plentiful however. Also ordered "The Works" pizza which was just okay, nothing special.  I enjoy the original pizza crust pizza, but the ingredients on this pizza were not very flavorful and nothing stood out about this pizza.

Service here is horrible.  The hostess called us to be seated, but just kidding, table wasn't ready yet.  When we finally were seated, we had to flag our server, Taryn, down to order.  There were multiple tables flagging down servers to place their orders throughout the night in various parts of the restaurant, including the table next to us.  Just don't expect service unless you are actively trying to get it.   Later, the MANAGER brought the wrong order to our table.  The manager then asked us if we needed anything and we specified two plates, which he acknowledged but decided to forget immediately as he walked off.  We then had to flag the server down again to get plates and refill our very empty glasses with water.   Half way through our meal, with clearly half of the other part of the meal on the table, the server asked if we wanted dessert.  We were confused as we were not even close to finished.  We informed her that we were still finishing up so after we'd take a look at the menu.  She got tired of waiting and decided we didn't need dessert after all and just brought the check instead.  This girl did not want to work anymore and was ready to be done with her shift. The servers here were mostly high school kids and they were on their phones most of the time.  Not sure why management would even permit cell phones on the service floor since it seemed to make the servers inefficient.  Seems like management should get trained up first and then disseminate.     Lastly, the women's bathroom was not clean.  In fact, the toilet had poop stains splattered around the rim.  Even the servers in the bathroom complained about how dirty the bathrooms were but didn't do anything but just complain.  Looks like the bathrooms don't get attention either.  Not coming back.

Love their new farmers market veggie soup and curbside delivery. All-star menu perfect for the whole family. Quinoa salad is also very good. 1 star less because I am experiencing longer wait times even at 6pm and they do not take table reservations.

This review is based on customer service and the quality of the food I received. First time I ordered the Halibut which was absolutely tasteless...and way over priced for what I got. Today I ordered "dine in" instead of take out, because I wanted to have somewhere to sit during my break since there was no room at work, plus the quality of food seems to be better with restaurants when you have it there versus taking it to go. Anyways, I get there and the hostess was sweet but had no idea what I meant when I told her I ordered "dine in" from online. I then proceeded to the take out area who gave me my food all packaged up to go and told me I had ordered take out. I am very irritated because I was already unhappy with my last experience, and now I have no where to relax and enjoy my food and it's going to be poorer quality because they prepared it as to go. I just left and decided to find somewhere else outside. I opened my food, which I wish I had checked before leaving, to find exactly what I had not wanted. The cedar plank salmon looked and tasted dry, they did not give me the lime that it comes with, and did not include feta cheese on the corn succatosh...it was literally just corn and spinach, and from ordering it before when I actually had dined in, I'm pretty sure there was more to it. I definitely didn't get my money's worth again. Poor service, and poor food.

I was super excited to try CPK as a newcomer to the area, as it was recommended by friends. I was mildly disappointed. The service was slow every time, and a couple of times it was outright dismissive. The food was decently proportioned, but the quality does not match the price. :/ It looks like they've been improving recently, and I hope that trend continues!

Two stars for the delicious dipping sauce and California Club pizza!  Zero stars for service...everyone around us got bread and oil/vinegar but we had to ask for ours.  We got our bread, pizza, and appetizer all at the same time...not good when you have hungry kids with you.  Also, we had to wait quite some time for a table and for the food...Wouldn't go back because of the wait and slow service.

Ordered food from the Palo Alto CPK through a delivery service from here. Food was great until I found a hair at the bottom of the dish. But CPK didn't seem to care much as they refused to provide A refund, a discount, credit. Nothing! Maybe hair is delicacy here? Lol. Guess I won't be eating here anymore.

I had the Pepperoni special. The crust was what I considered, New York style, and was OK. The sauce tasted like cheap tomato paste with a little fresh oregano... too sweet and bitter. The sauce overpowered the fresh mozzarella. The pepperoni was OK. Save your money and find another place.

My girlfriend and I frequent this eatery.  Last time my husband joined us.  Everything was alright up and till the bill came.  The waiter took the bill and cash and never returned.  He avoided eye contact with us.  I guess he felt that the change was his tip.  Actually I was going to leave him more.  (Both my husband and I have worked in restaurants in the past.)  But we were in a hurry to get to the doctor's office so I just left matters as the stood.  But I am going to have to find another restaurant to eat at on my frequent visits to Stanford.

The service is great! But lately, they there take out service has been slow. Just wish that CPK would have a better estimate when it comes to my orders. Instead, I end up waiting, on average, an additional 10 minutes.
food is ok. service is good. thank you to our server Charissa/Charisse. not sure, can't really tell the last letters of her name.

California Pizza Kitchen aka CPK has been a favorite of mine since high school!! I particularly enjoy this location because it is at the Stanford Shopping Center, it's very close to my job, the customer service here is amazing and the food is always on point. This locations seems to always be crowded and busy no matter what time or what day, the patio dining area seems to be extremely popular with people on nice days and it is more ideal dining on the patio than inside since the interior can get a little crammed and hectic. While they are known for their pizza with the BBQ Chicken Pizza being their most popular one, their menu is quite interesting and I definitely come here for other items. The pizza here is good, my favorite is the pepperoni since I'm very simple and plain when it come to pizza. Their crust is nice and crispy and chewy and has a bit of a sweetness to it and that's why I fell in love with the pizza. It's just different. I really love their spinach and artichoke dip as well, it's hands down the best I've ever had and a lot of the times I will do just to have that along with their hot bread and that can be a meal in itself. I'm a big pasta person so of course I've tried some of their pasta dishes which are very good as well, I particularly am a fan of the Garlic Cream Fettuccine  (   ). The sauce is very garlicky but not overpowering and it's one of the better pastas on the menu along with the Jambalaya Fettuccine.  The also have lunch duos which I find myself ordering more often, you can get a 7'' pizza and salad or soup and salad for no more than $10. It's just enough food and good for the price. Their salads and soups are yummy here as well, they have a new soup the Baked Potato soup and it is very creamy with nice chunks of potato topped with crisp bacon and scallions. This is my new fav soup, I'm a sucker for any type of potato soup. CPK definitely is a great restaurant and they have a lot of variety as far as their menu goes so you are not restricted to just pizza, they some good deals and great service. Oh and dessert if you don't remember anything try the butter cake and the Red Velvet Cake  (   ), both are very good. The food is worth the price and you won't be disappointed.

A group of 6 of us came in for lunch while waiting for our family member to undergo an operation nearby at Stanford Hospital. The manager found out why we were they and before the meal was over brought us a get well card signed by the entire staff. I have no idea how they found out but the gesture was amazing. The food was excellent, I had the crispy chicken sandwich and would recommend the avocado egg rolls. The BBQ classic chicken pizza is always a 10. Just want to thank the manager and staff for giving us a bright spot in an otherwise tough day.

I was greeted by the door by someone I presume to be the manager - well dressed, well mannered, friendly. It was shaping up to be a great experience. Too bad it was all downhill from there. I approached the takeout counter, which was being manned by Monica. I asked her what sizes the pizzas were because I've never been there before. She gave me as exasperated look as if I had offended her and told me they have kids size, regular crust, and thin crust. I asked what size would be good for two people and she repeated the above statement. I asked if there was actually a difference in those pizza sizes and she repeated the above statement. Look, I know it's late and 20 minutes before you close, but I'm not having trouble hearing your only answer and your attitude is appalling. Not wanting to talk to her anymore, I ordered a pizza and she put in the order and walked away. At this point, I realized she never answered my original question of shat size would be good for two people, so I flag down someone and ask if one pizza would be enough for two people. The guy says yes, so I leave it at that. 20 minutes later, I get my pizza and it is TINY. Maybe enough for two children to split, but definitely NOT two full grown adults. What the hell, CPK?! I was more than willing to buy a second pizza, just be honest about your pizza sizes! When I explained this to the guy who told me one pizza would be enough to split, he just shrugged and asked if I wanted bread on the side to go. No I don't want bread to fill up on! If I wanted bread instead of pizza, I would have gone to a bakery instead. TL;DR - lack of concern for customers needs and poor attitude. Not once did I feel valued as a customer. What a disappointing experience.

We were looking to have an early lunch at 11 at the Stanford Mall and there were not a lot of options. We decided to keep it simple and headed to CPK which turned out OK. It has a sports bar feel and the food was decent. You really can't go with the brussel sprout goat cheese flatbread.

For a chain restaurant I was so surprised by how much I loved this place! It was pouring so we wanted something warm for lunch. We had to wait about 15-20 minutes which was no big deal. The menu is pretty big, and it was so hard to choose what to get. It was a classic Pasta vs Pizza. We decided on flat bread appetizer with sage, and oh it was good! I ordered a classic margarita pizza and it was just awesome! The cheese wasn't as crispy as I normally like, but the ingredients were fresh and tasted clean and good!  Also the crust...it may be the softest and best crust I've ever had! I kept eating more! We will be back next time we're in the area to try the pasta!

We stopped by after some shopping for a quick bite, place looked half empty, but hostess said it is 20 min wait. After I pointed out that half of the tables are empty, she said they are not been cleaned yet. So, I asked for the table outside, because surely I can see that at least 10 tables are available, she sent another hostess to check, that guy just disappointed. After waiting another 10 min, we finally got table outside. The tables inside still were not cleaned while 3 more hostesses were standing , doing nothing.  Looked incompetent.  Our waiter was great! Very courageous, welcoming, accommodative. The food was coming fast enough and was not bad at all.

I received a private message from CPK manager Emilee and she apologized for my bad experience with their service , and it shows that they care about customer's concerns , so I give them a 4 star . Thank you !

CPK is one of my favorite restaurants, and the Stanford location happens to be the closest near where I live. The food quality is great, price is fair, and the portions are always generous. I'd like to especially acknowledge Tinno and Juan, both of whom have provided excellent service every single visit, regardless of time of day or how busy it is. Would highly recommend this place to anyone looking to satisfy a food craving!
Servers are a hit or miss, sometimes really nice, sometimes couldn't care less about the customers. Pizza is delicious, and so is the zin (though a little overpriced). Like it :)

My order never got delivered on 1/23/17 - as the matter of fact was delivered somewhere else, cancelled my order and i was told I am getting credit back to my credit cars of course nothing happened, on 2/1/17 called again and ask them where is my credit they said we process today instead of getting credit they charge my credit cars again.  They lost a customer after so many years i refuse to go there. I found this place very dishonest.  got an email that please give us your phone number we would like too talk about it, again nothing happened no one called. profect your money and credit card from this place. I will file against them for credit card fraud.

I have been coming here for a long time. Always order the Thai Crunch salad NO meat - however today for my surprise i paid $17 for supposingly their large portion the only thing large was their new take out container and salad is not worth $17.. no more CPK FOR ME!!

Always love the food here! Good, simpleish menu with lots of good variety for pizza, pasta, and salad. Always a long wait at dinner time though and not very fast to seat you. We love coming here after being at the mall all afternoon!
Pizza was dry and tasteless. Pasta was dry too. So disappointed for such a pricey place. Not going back.

There are plenty of nice restaurants at the mall.  I chose CPK because it appeals to a 10-year-old.  I was a bit disappointed they didn't have the charred shishito peppers I saw on their website.  SIGH We got the white corn guacamole chips, sesame ginger chicken dumplings, Dakota smashed peas + barley soup, and lunch duo of pepperoni pizza and baked potato soup.  My favorite was the dumplings.  My niece liked her soup and pizza.  The guac needed more flavor.  The only detectable spice was black pepper.  Another spice or two can really elevator this app.  The pea barley soup did not meet my expectations, and I LOVE barley soups. I ordered the Mediterranean veggie rolls and the shaved mushroom and spinach flatbread to take out.  Both were burnt!  SMH...

"this is the worst club sandwich i've ever had" - my friend who orders a club sandwich almost everywhere i got the quinoa and arugula salad. going in, i hate arugula but almost every other option wasn't vegetarian or didn't sound good, so i figured whatever i'll give arugula another try. bad choice. let's forget i hate arugula for a moment, because that's not even why my salad was nastier than a mayo infested potato salad at the end of a bbq. the asparagus in my salad was cooked but a bit mushy, they had way too many onions, and whatever dressing used was less flavorful than the playdough i ate as a toddler. my friend also got the potato soup which honestly tasted like it was out of a plastic package and like the amount of cream was supposed to make up for the lack of actual flavor. food sucks but the people who worked there were all very nice. i also appreciate how dog friendly they are.
Food wasn't as we expected; portions seemed smaller than at other locations. Service was extremely slow. Will not be returning to this location again.
Good food  Crappy service Rude request to leave because they wanted to close early.  Won't come here again.  Will go to other CPK's though.

Went for lunch on a Saturday; were seated pretty quickly. Our service was great and the food came fast. We all liked the wild mushroom pizza and the California club pizza (interesting concept). We also shared the buffalo cauliflower (they're amazing little bombs of flavor) and the grilled veggie salad.  The complaints were only that the A/C felt like it was on full blast, so super cold sitting inside, and the music was very loud.

We came on a Saturday and the service was fast. It was so fast that we were seated in a few minutes and waiter came to get our orders as soon as our bottoms hit the chairs.  However, at 7.30 on a Saturday night, they were out of beef, so they couldn't fulfill my Carne Asada pizza order.  There are many waiters and waitresses cleaning the tables as soon as the food is finished (fast, fast, fast) but they didn't refill the glasses.  The food was OK.

They don't have tiramisu and that was one of my favorite things about CPK! :*( * California pizza club - 3.5 stars: This was probably one of my favorite things - I liked the flavor and the soft crust. I would order it again but not come here just for that.  * Lettuce wraps - 3 stars: I prefer the ones at PF Changs across the street. It's quite a decent portion and nothing special.  * Mac n Cheese Fritters - 3 stars: I mean, how can you go wrong with this? I wasn't a huge fan but it tastes exactly like you would expect. * Chinese Chicken Salad - 2.5 stars: Pretty standard, not sure what the hype is about this.  Pro-tip: They sell discount CPK gift cards at Costco.

I don't know what to say.  CPK has been a staple for my family since 10 years plus.   Today we ordered 2 pizzas and a pasta.  And 3 drinks and just some bread. The bread did not show up for 35 minutes.  The drinks showed up in 30. This was on a Friday at 2 pm when the wait was less then 5 minutes. Worse yet the pizza was not cooked.  Once.  Sent it back.  The next one - not cooked.  Oh well.  Bad food, long wait. And the capper - the waitress extreme bad attitude.  Rude.  Avoid this place - catch Chipotle or something close by.  This is not the right place to be.

Been going here regularly because my children love the cheese pizza. Last time our cheese pizza was burned (black spots all over the pizza). Finally got fed up during another visit with the attitude from the host/hostess stand. Phoned in our order while driving for takeout order. Got there within 5 minutes at the most, asked if it would be alright to eat in instead. The host and hostess (2 people) replied "No, absolutely not." No reason given, no apology, just a very curt 3 word reply. Really? We were there early afternoon on a Sunday, plenty of tables available and our order was not ready for another 20 minutes. Bye Bye CPK, you lost a customer, not going here again! Plenty of other dining options close by.

CPK is a surprisingly fun/trendy place to go to for dinner! I came here hesitantly once with a friend just because we happened to be at Stanford. From the outside, it looked really average and casual. Inside, it was dark and the decor was surprisingly trendy and nice. It was still casual but definitely felt like a nicer restaurant than what I was expecting. I *might* come back if I'm ever in the area.

Service can be erratic with long wait times. This is partially offset by the wide ranging menu. I want to commend CPK for their addition of two gluten free versions of their pizzas. We now prefer the gluten free version of their signature Barbeque chicken pizza to the non gluten free one.

Even though my experience was very sub par, I still tipped 20%. The waitress can only do so much. It's very clear that senior executives/CEO of this organization is way out of touch of how the locations...and from the look, lack of cleanliness of the place, and attitude of the staff...they probably run the organization on reports from middle management only.  1. Upon entering we were not greeted in a manner consistent with the standard, "Hello. Welcome to California Kitchen. How many are in your party?" It was just a "how many?" 2. Even during that exchange, the manner on duty jumped and said table 48 is open. I then asked if they had a full liquor license. To which they do.  3. Our waitress, God bless her heart...did the best she could. She didn't ask if I wanted a salad with my meal. She just took the order and moved on.  4. Our food was not brought together. My friend got his salad first. 15 minutes later he got his pizza. 20 minutes later I got my steak... which sat in the service area for like 5 minutes of that 20 before the waitress brought it to me. 5. The food itself not bad. But for 27 bucks for a steak... just expecting a little bit more on the flavor and zest side. 6. The cosmo was good and in a real glass. So that's a win.  7. When it was time to pay up, well we had to get folks attention. And it took us a while, as three staff members stood around and chatted about their closing duties and who did what.  There was a reason(s) why I haven't there in 10+ years.  Yet it still beats fast food... Please forgive any typos, etc... Thank You.
Really?  We had a party of 17 people and you are going to tell me that we can only split the check once because you are lazy.  Not coming back.

My wife and I used love the now closed CPK store on Cowper St., so after a while traveling we somehow had a yearning for, in her case, the Wild Mushroom Pizza and in mine the Sicilian. So we decided to give the store at Stanford Shopping Center a try. When we arrived they told us the wait would be 20 mins. We were happy when it was only about 10. After seating water and bread was dropped promptly. Soon after our server arrived. So far, so good. We ordered a bottle of wine, an appetizer, and two pizzas. MINUS ONE STAR: After about 15mins of enjoying bread and water we asked our server what happened our wine. She apologized and came back to the table and dumped (yes dumped) the wine and two glasses and walked off.  MINUS TWO STARS: So after a very long wait our pizzas arrived, we remarked to the servers that, well, we had not had our appetizer... They kinda shrugged... MINUS THREE STARS: Our appetizer arrives. My wife's pizza was cold so we swap her pizza for the Shrimp Lettuce Cups... We are at this point a bit disgruntled, but rolling with the punches. MINUS FOUR STARS: My wife excuses herself (to go to the bathroom -- figure out why here); the Shrimp lettuce cups have "meat" in them; she does not eat meat.  MINUS FIVE STARS: I call the server over and point out that the Shrimp lettuce cups have "meat" = "chicken" in them. She disbelieves me and checks with the kitchen. She comes back and assures me there is no chicken in what we have been served and my wife is mistaken. i dig around in the mixture, produce a piece of chicken meat and confirm by eating it in front of her that it is, indeed, chicken. I ask for a manager. MINUS SIX STARS: A manager comes out to deliver my wife's now warm pizza; It's the same pizza from before desiccated to point where when she picks up a slice it falls apart. MINUS SEVEN STARS: Manager shows us the underside of the pizza and argues since it is not black the pizza is not burnt. We cancel the mushroom pizza and the manager offers us free dessert. MINUS EIGHT STARS: We really don't want dessert, but I worked for years in the hospitality industry so I know it is important to allow a reasonable way of making good. We chose the salted caramel pudding. They must have taken one from the wrong side of the fridge (the ones to be chilled for tomorrow); it was a sloppy runny mess. At this point we just gave up. They comped the cancelled pizza, the lettuce cups and the dessert... So I might have given then a pass, but seriously a server arguing about the content of a dish? Lucky for my wife it's just she does not eat meat... If she had an allergy? Starting with 5 stars this is a -3 start review, but Yelp does not allow that, so one star.

Definitely come here between 11 am to 4 pm on weekdays, they have lunch duos where you can get either a pizza and salad, half a sandwich and salad, or soup and salad for very low prices! The pizza for the lunch duo is a mini one and along with the salad, it's just the right amount of food. I recommend the mushroom sausage and pepperoni pizza!

At first, my visit here was off to a rocky start. The waiter forgot to bring us the bread and took at least 15 minutes to bring us our drinks. But he was very nice and took care of the issue once we reminded him!  I got a lunch duo. I ordered the California Vegetarian Sandwich and the Caesar salad. They were both delicious and on point.  There is plenty of seating both outside and inside. There was no wait to be seated and the host was kind. The music inside was a bit strange and I feel that it contributed to somewhat of an odd ambience.

Food is not bad, service pretty good but they definitely don't stick to selling what they advertise. Ordered their Ultimate Bloody Mary which is supposed to come with a fennel salted rim and topped with spicy pepperoni, mozzarella, olive,lemon and thyme.  As you can see from the picture none of these were included in the drink. Additionally there was NO fennel in the salt. When asked,  the waiter (who was clueless about the menu) checked with the bartender and came back to say that they "ran out" of pepperoni. When asked about the mozzarella he said they ran out of mozzarella as well.  WTH!  A pizza place with no pepperoni or mozzarella?  Seriously?  You can't make this stuff up!  It would of been nice if they ended up comping the drink because it wasn't what the menu said. Instead I was charged full price....buyer beware!

I've only been to CPK twice, and this was my second - I was actually quite impressed. The reason for going was that they're doing a Philanthropizza fundraiser for an organization I am a part of, donating 20% of the bill, which is awesome! Arrived with the family and I ordered the Roasted artichoke and spinach pizza and split a half order of BBQ chicken salad with my brother. The BBQ chicken salad was better than expected. The chicken was still warm, and the BBQ sauce was nice and tangy. The roasted artichoke and spinach pizza came on a thin crust so it was a little flimsy with chunky artichokes on top - still delicious and hearty though. With the half salad and pizza, I took home leftovers. Would be down to go again to try some of their other unique pizzas.

Great service, awesome food and just a fun place to eat lunch. The protein bowl is delish! Very healthy and all the best ingredients! They offer outside seating which is nice for warm days. Never had pizza there but it does look pretty good! I usually get a salad or just appetizers with my co workers.

I actually like this place. Simple, fast, clean and good pizza. I've ordered cheese pizza  and it was ready for 15-20 minutes. I enjoyed it. It was so good, thin cheese pizza, with a lot of different cheeses. Prices are little high, but it's ok.

The servers tonight seemed a little out of it/distracted tonight. They kept forgetting simple details, never came by to check up to see if we liked our food, had to get up about 3 times to ask for utensils, drink refills, and to put in an order for another appetizer. I mean they were nice just didn't seem like the guests needs were #1 tonight....besides that food was great on point as always had the buffalo caauliflower, Szechwan dumplings, and a cup of the tortilla soup. maybe il have better luck another time with the service

Avoid this location.  I called and made a reservation for a party of 10, but when I arrived was told that they don't accept reservations for tables inside the restaurant.  The manager then came over and insinuated that I must be lying, as 'all of the employees know that inside reservations are not taken'.  The manager never apologized for their mistake, but instead treated us very rudely.  After waiting 20 minutes for a table to open up, we were offered two tables at opposite ends of the restaurant, or the option to continue waiting.  Still no apology, just more rudeness from the manager who wanted to know if 'we were going to take it or not'.  We decided 'not' and were able to get a table at the restaurant around the corner in shopping center. Believe the other reviews regarding poor service at this location.  Poor management appears to be leading to unhappy employees and bad treatment of customers.  I recommend taking your business somewhere else.
Great tortilla soup. Not good for vegetarians, as avocado roll cannot be made vegetarian. The tortilla veggie roll had too much cheese. Really nice server though!!

I've been to this restaurant a few times, the pizza's are good. I like the small size perfect for one hungry person or to share if you are not so hungry. Today I wanted to try something different so I ordered the fish taco's. Although the portion was very generous (3 big taco's) with a side of chips and salsa, the fish was not fresh and tasted way too fishy. The taco's had a fantastic sauce and were tasty otherwise. The chips were cold and bland, but the salsa was very good. I would not order this again. I think next time I will stick to the pizza's, which are their specialty and taste really good.  Other than that, the service was good, and the wait was way shorter than the hostess had predicted.

It's unfortunate that Stanford Shopping Center has such few family friendly dining options. This lack of options will find you waiting a really long time for a table.  When you finally get one you'll find out their beer tap is broken and that they are unsure of what they have in a bottle.  They'll then bring you a wheat beer when you asked for an IPA.  When that's finally figured out, you will order and your server will put everyone's order in, but not yours.  After that, you will ask for ketchup for a kid's meal and never get it.  They will then ask to comp a dessert, but it will take so long to get it you'll just want to leave and cut your losses.  All of this would be kind of funny if it wasn't happening to you.   This place was ridiculous and I will not ever patronize again.

If I could give 0 stars for this place I would. I'm not sure what kind of place they are running here!  Worst place to have a family dinner at! Our order consisted of 2 pizzas,salmon plate, garlic Alfredo, and tequila lime chicken. We had to constantly ask them about my tequila lime chicken because everyone was finishing up their food. My tequila lime chicken never came so we told the waitress to cancel the order because everyone had finished their food. Approximately 2-3 minutes later the manager came out to bring my food even though I had witnessed the waitress telling her manager that our table had cancelled. The manager offered to not charge for my plate and asked if I still wanted it. I accepted her offer and told her to put it in a take out container because I wasn't about to make my dinner guests sit there and wait until I finish eating. By the time we were done paying the packed up pasta never came. I had to ask about it again!  The finale is that when I go home hours later into the night I open up the container just to find less than a half sized order of pasta. I have no idea what happened to the other half. Did the manager or waitress take it home to eat because cpk doesn't pay for their meals.

Food is always good. Service is hit and miss. Tonight was a complete miss. Our pizza was given to another table and our waitress did not notice u til we asked why the people seated next to us got their pizza is 15 minutes.  We waited 65 minutes for a pizza.
Very average food.  I got their specialty bbq chicken pizza and it was just not great at all :-/

Good food small location compared to others I've been to but got seated right away on the patio. Service was decent but seemed to take awhile to get our items. She had the chicken club sandwich and I had my usual Kung Pao Spaghetti. I ordered their "new" ultimate Bloody Mary which was supposed to be topped with olives, pepperoni, mozzarella and herbs and all it did was come with a lime. Told they didn't have the normal ingredients. I think those are ingredients that go on their pizzas but yet not on their Bloody Mary. And watered down. Came here because of convenient location to the shopping we did at the mall but won't come to this location again.

Got a CPK pepperoni pizza at Stanford women's basketball game Thur night. If I would have been closer to the concession stand, I would have taken it back. It obviously sat there for two hours. The cheese was all melted. Crust was like hard pita bread, very little pepperoni and sauce. What a ripoff.

We came here during rush hour on a Saturday so I wasn't surprised to see it really busy. We were told it was gonna be a 25 minute wait but we were hungry so we sat down. It wasn't even 10 minutes before they sat us at our table and gave us time to go over the menu. The waiting for one item was a bit much but the food was worth it. Our server Lexi was so patient and really attentive. We ordered the Sicilian pizza and shared it between us both and it was really good. Would definitely come back. :)

Been here a couple of times i feel like the service is always slow and they take forever to bring youre food out but i get its a busy mall i recently went again on a monday and was not busy and the staff seemed to be overwhelmed whoever this "AMY" woman is she is rude  and has no idea what  the meaning of customer service  is first off she was rude since the beggining they took like 25 to take our order then our waiter seemed to be stressed kept forgetting everything bringing the wrong stuff or not even bringing simple Parmesan cheese to go with the pasta on top of that they kept coming rushing our family to go and if i needed boxes it was a hot mess . Amy please ask your main manager to train you better &  maybe take a course on  how to treat people  properly i can only imagine how you treat the employees

This review is all about convenience.  CPK at this location is not baby friendly at all. They ask you to leave the stroller outside at the front, but they aren't responsible for it if it is stolen. We have a infant in his car seat. For that reason, there is a extra wait time. I wonder why. The stuffs at the reception wasn't able to explain.  We are meeting friends here. I will see if my stroller is still there when we are done.

If you haven't been to the California Pizza Kitchen then I recommend you doing so especially for their 7-inch lunch size pizza. The original BBQ chicken pizza and the California Veggie are the best (at least they are my favorite ones). I have had pizza at other places but this pizza kitchen does it right, probably too good for a chain restaurant. They put enough of everything on it that makes it outrageously good. I always enjoy my time at the California Pizza Kitchen and it's my new best spot to be. I can see it being for a long time to come! Service can be a little frustrating but the great food makes you forget all the bad!
